Job_Description:
WHY BCA?
BCA is a leading Architecture and Engineering firm in New York State. We have offices in Ithaca, Saratoga Springs, Rochester, and Watertown. Our clients are institutional, and our projects are the building blocks of communities, cities, towns, and villages across the state. We design K-12 Schools, Water / Wastewater / Stormwater Infrastructure, Roads, Bridges, Streets, Colleges and Universities, and Healthcare Facilities.

Our engineers and architects provide a wide range of professional services including architecture; civil, mechanical, plumbing, electrical, structural, transportation, and environmental engineering; landscape architecture; and project management.

Our new, modern offices are in some of the most beautiful communities in the State. Our staff has access to the latest tech, and we are always improving our workflows and implementing software in new and exciting ways. Our staff is fully equipped to offer the best service we can to our clients.

Our goal has always been to develop trusting, long-standing relationships that are mutually rewarding, both professionally and personally. This balance is why we have been successful in business for over 50 years.

JOB SUMMARY: The Civil/Site Engineer provides general support to the Director of Landscape Architecture on site work projects.This position assists with conceptual level designs and estimates while preparing schematic, design development and construction documentation complete with required technical specifications. Tasks will include all aspects of landscape and site design and construction drawing set production at a range of scales from master planning documentation to detailed site design. Adept communication is required to effectively collaborate with team members.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Coordinate with the Director of Landscape Architecture for project specific needs and expectations.
Collaborate with project managers on schedules, budget, progress and necessary support from other departments.
Provide context for the initial design phase of projects, considering stakeholders, client values, and history and ecology of sites.
Create and compile schematic and construction documentation.
Perform stormwater drainage analysis, design storm drainage conveyance systems, and develop Stormwater Pollution Prevention Plans (SWPPP)
Create and compile construction details for use in construction document sets reflective of best construction practices.
Actively participates in project coordination meetings.
Perform site visits photographing existing conditions, general site analysis, and compiling all relevant data.
Prepare construction cost estimates, including researching current cost factors and evaluating recent bid activity.
Modify technical specifications specific to each project as required
Perform Construction SWPPP Inspections

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE:
Bachelor’s degree in Landscape Architecture or Civil Engineering.
5+ years’ experience in site related design and construction documentation. A focus on education markets or athletic planning and design is preferred.
General understanding of NYS DEC related storm water management requirements in relation to construction projects.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES:
Proficient in AutoCAD, Civil 3D, Microsoft Office, Photoshop, Sketchup, Adobe, Bluebeam and GIS.
Ability to critically analyze the functional aspects of a site, topography, movement of water, ecology, human movement through space.
Flexibility balancing design vision with client and project goals.
Diligent about adhering to drawing standards and best management practices.
Ability to understand how a project comes together from start to finish.
Excellent verbal and written skills, including ability to present to others in small and large group formats.
Ability to multi-task and handle competing priorities effectively, while delivering quality work on time.
Excellent analytical and critical thinking skills, with a priority on cost effectiveness and client satisfaction.

PAY RANGE:
$70,000 - $110,000 per year depending on experience and licensure.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

Job_Description:
LA Solar Group is searching for a PV Systems (AutoCAD) Engineer to join our team! The ideal candidate thrives in a dynamic environment and looking to work for a company that is innovative and on the cutting edge of solar in California. To learn more about our company, visit our webpage and check us out on Facebook
A quality applicant needs to have demonstrated experience working on solar PV projects and have a strong interest in supporting the rapid expansion of solar in our region.
Responsibilities:
Complete initial preliminary engineering in coordination with our project development team for solar projects entering full development phase including initial electrical designs for utility interconnection applications and permitting packages
Collaborate with our team in interfacing with the utility on utility interconnection technical feasibility reports and screening criteria
Complete system designs for solar projects including: site plans, mechanical racking and attachment plans, three-line electrical drawings, specification of BOS location and interconnection details, and labeling
Provide technical design information for the projects described above to the permitting and interconnection admin teams as needed
Interface with and provide streamlined project information to the procurement and construction workers
Understand the optimal design applications and design limitations of our standard products and lead the evaluation of alternate products as needed


Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree (B.A./B.S.) from a four-year college or university in engineering or related field
At least 3 years experience designing/engineering PV systems both residential and commercial
NABCEP PV Installation Professional Certification, or completion during employment.
Possesses working knowledge of current National Electrical Code.
Proficient using PVSYST
Experience with AutoCAD required.

Job_Description:
About us
We are the independent expert in assurance and risk management. Driven by our purpose, to safeguard life, property, and the environment, we empower our customers and their stakeholders with facts and reliable insights so that critical decisions can be made with confidence.
As a trusted voice for many of the world’s most successful organizations, we use our knowledge to advance safety and performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions to tackle global transformations.
About the role
Are you passionate about renewable energy and looking to expand your impact? Are you interested in having a hand in shaping the direction of the fast-growing wind, offshore wind, and hydrogen industry? DNV’s Energy Transition Outlook predicts that we will exhaust the 1.5 degree carbon budget in 2028. How will you spend your next 5 years making a measurable impact on climate change mitigation?

DNV Energy’s Electrical Engineering team is growing rapidly. Our team is comprised of highly skilled electrical engineers performing owner’s engineering, preliminary design, interconnection services, technical due diligence for new construction and repowering, and construction monitoring for the wind, offshore wind, solar PV, energy storage, and emerging technologies industries.

We are seeking a Senior Electrical Engineer - Wind Onshore/Offshore to join our team. The Senior Engineer’s skillset will both shape the direction and application of expertise to services, as well as complement a group of highly skilled, Senior- and Principal level experts making a daily impact in the development, design, and construction of projects. The Senior Engineer, depending on skillsets and interest, will perform a wide variety of technical tasks applying experience and training in electrical power systems, electronics, controls, and instrumentation in support of the design, development, and construction of renewable energy projects.

Within DNV’s Renewables and Power Grids group and organizational culture, how we collectively influence the world for future generations matters deeply to us. Our team works every day to increase the widespread deployment and operation of renewables to address climate change and positively impact society; endeavors to achieve our purpose through the success of our customers; and strives to be high-performing and innovative. Our approach reflects the equity, respect, and diversity we wish to see in the world.
This position can be located in our Austin, TX; Houston, TX; Medford, MA; Oakland, CA; San Diego, CA; Portland, OR; and Seattle, WA offices. Other DNV offices may also be considered.

What you’ll do:
Act as a collaborative subject matter expert on electrical engineering projects, authoring and/or reviewing technical reports alongside a variety of internal teams, including independent engineering, asset operations, onshore and offshore wind advisory, permitting, civil engineering, turbine technology, power systems advisory (grid and markets studies group), and other teams globally
Review electrical designs and interconnection contracts and studies for onshore wind, offshore wind, high voltage substation design, and other projects
Support business development activities in North America, by demonstrating curiosity and engaging in authentic, expertise-driven discussions with DNV’s 25+ key accounts and over 100+ renewable energy customers in North America. Identify opportunities across multiple renewable energy types to offer value-added services to customers as a seller-doer
Support strategy, market positioning, and develop thought leadership (committee engagements, conference attendance and developing webinars, guides and standards development, whitepapers and/or blog posts)
Perform or review power system studies such as grounding, reactive power, cable ampacity, and preliminary collection system design using computer software and other methods
Provide guidance and training in electrical commissioning, safety, and procedures
The Electrical Engineer will enjoy a wide variety of field and analytical work including in-depth work in the full spectrum of electric power systems, with frequent interaction with experts from the related turbine, energy analysis, environmental, and civil engineering groups
What we offer
Generous paid time off (vacation, sick days, company holidays, personal days)
Multiple Medical and Dental benefit plans to choose from, Vision benefits
Spending accounts – FSA, Dependent Care, Commuter Benefits, company-seeded HSA
Employer-paid, therapist-led, virtual care services through Talkspace
401(k) with company match
Company provided life insurance, short-term, and long-term disability benefits
Education reimbursement program
Flexible work schedule with hybrid/remote opportunities
Charitable Matched Giving and Volunteer Rewards through our Impact Program
Volunteer time off (VTO) paid by the company
Career advancement opportunities
**Benefits vary based on position, tenure, location, and employee election**
How We Do It
We Care, We Dare, We Share
DNV is a proud equal-opportunity employer committed to building an inclusive and diverse workforce. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, or business need, without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.
DNV is committed to ensuring equal employment opportunity, including providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with a disability. US applicants with a physical or mental disability who require a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process may contact the North America Recruitment Department (hrrecruitment.northamerica@dnv.com). Information received relating to accommodations will be addressed confidentially.
DNV is proud to announce being named one of Houston’s best places to work in the 2022 Houston Business Journal – Best Places to Work competition.

Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors, including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and specific office location. For the states of Colorado, New York City, NY, California, Washington, and Connecticut only, the range of starting pay for this role is $110,000 - $135,000 USD.
About you
What Is Required
Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering
7+ years’ experience directly working on renewable energy (including wind, transmission and/or power electronics) projects
Electrical system studies and modeling
Knowledge of IEEE, IEC, NEC, and CIGRE standards and guidelines
Electrical system construction including distribution, substation, and transmission systems
Willingness to participate in 10-15% domestic travel (US and Canada), with more significant travel opportunities available if desired
Strong writing and communication skills for report writing, communication of technical concepts to internal and external clients is a must
We conduct pre-employment drug and background screening

Power generation, distribution, substations, and transmission
Protection, controls, and SCADA systems
Bulk electric system operation principals, reliability standards, and regulation

Are you excited about the opportunities created by the energy transition to decarbonize our economy? Would you like to be part of a team that helps our clients manage critical activities in a sustainable, cost-efficient, safe, and secure way?
DNV – Markets and Risk’s Design and Evaluation group is seeking an evaluation engineer to join our team of energy market research and evaluation professionals across the country. This group is dedicated to being our clients’ trusted advisors on addressing how their business adapts to the changing energy market. We are focused on helping our customers improve their energy efficiency and clean energy policies and develop and implement successful program offerings. The individual will perform field data collection, research, analysis, and reporting in support of residential, commercial, and industrial energy efficiency evaluation projects. The primary evaluation activity includes post-installation measurement and verification to ascertain the actual achieved energy performance of completed energy efficiency installations.
This is an in-office position based out of one of our offices, including Medford MA, North Andover MA, or Oakland CA.

Perform on-site building inspections and energy efficiency assessments of electric and natural gas systems
Verify installations, operations, and performance characteristics of energy efficiency equipment
Install measurement equipment and analyze measured data, including data loggers, power recorders, and other data acquisition systems
Perform energy analysis using advanced spreadsheets and building simulation software
Analyze energy performance and report the impacts associated with efficiency improvements
Interview energy managers, consumers, and other relevant personnel
Recruit and schedule survey and/or on-site visits on behalf of project team members

About us
We are the independent expert in assurance and risk management. Driven by our purpose, to safeguard life, property, and the environment, we empower our customers and their stakeholders with facts and reliable insights so that critical decisions can be made with confidence.
As a trusted voice for many of the world’s most successful organizations, we use our knowledge to advance safety and performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions to tackle global transformations.
About the role
Local Unit & Position Description
Suppose you have the ambition to grow with a flexible and dynamic team of people who genuinely believe hydrogen and low-carbon fuels are important energy carriers/storage mediums to support the energy transition. In that case, DNV has a spot for you. Our Hydrogen talent is passionate about creating a safer and more sustainable world.

DNV Energy Systems is seeking a consultant– Process Engineer to join our Hydrogen and low-carbon fuels team. In this role, you will work with a group of process engineers, supporting other colleagues in identifying customizable solutions to clients’ challenges in their energy transition endeavors. Your contributions will help maintain DNV’s know-how around hydrogen as a fuel and feed to other processes. This know-how will readily respond to clients’ requests in a fast-paced environment.

DNV – Energy Systems – Hydrogen & Low Carbon Fuel aspires to become the preferred business partner to support customers in mitigating their risks by providing high-quality due diligence studies focusing on green hydrogen production and its integration to a supply chain or the production of derivatives such as ammonia, methanol or synthetic fuels. Among the challenges that a process engineer in the team will be facing are process modeling of several scales of a facility depending on the customer’s requirements and the preparation of Front-end Loading (FEL) documents from the identification of the opportunity (FEL 0) to Select (FEL 2).
The first preference for this role is the Seattle, WA, and the Houston, TX offices.

What You’ll Do
Produce or update competitive intelligence reports following literature reviews to identify the latest technology developments and technology readiness levels of relevant technologies
Support colleagues with preparing a benchmarking of Levelized Costs of Hydrogen-derived products corresponding to several scales and technologies
Perform technical due diligence on processes for producing and using hydrogen, including processes to make hydrogen-derived products such as methanol, ammonia, and synthetic fuels
Being able to scale down processes and their corresponding cost estimates matching customers’ interests work in designing and optimizing production processes of different scales
Leverage a deep understanding of low-carbon fuel technologies and process modeling to predict and deliver scenarios supporting the customer's strategic decision-making process
Develop, lead, and coordinate mass and energy balance methodologies to assess end-use applications' technical and economic impacts
Contribute to the know-how building and knowledge management of the Process Engineering team
Support business development through participation in the preparation of proposals

Job_Description:
Overview:
Being on the BlueHalo team means working alongside the brightest minds in technology on the toughest challenges facing our nation – not just every once in a while, but every single day. Together, we are leading the transformation of modern warfare and each BlueHalo employee plays a key role. That’s why our investment in you goes beyond a rewarding salary and benefits package. We’re committed to providing our people with the best opportunities to develop their skills, share their knowledge, and push their innovative ideas to the cutting-edge. Having fun doing it with a team that feels like family all across BlueHalo Nation is the ultimate perk. From Space and Directed Energy to Cyber and Intelligence to C4ISR and Air & Missile Defense, there is no limit to where you can take your career with us. Are you ready to launch a career at BlueHalo?

BlueHalo is seeking to fill a Digital Signal Processing (DSP) Engineering position to support the SkyView family of Counter-UAS (c-UAS) systems. The candidate will apply their DSP and software engineering skills to developing solutions to enhance BlueHalo’s SkyView CUAS RF sensors.
You’d like to do this:
UAS Signals Exploitation
UAS Signals Detection Algorithm Development
EW Defeat Waveform Development
Prototyping and Development of advanced RF functions for use in current and future RF Sensor/Effector products
Optimization of current SkyView Software/RF architecture

Essential functions:
Optimization of current SkyView Software/RF architecture
Digital Signal Processing and Analysis
Exploitation of known and unknown RF signals
Programming of DSP detection and defeat algorithms using software defined radios
Work with SkyView HW, SW, and DSP engineers to improve upon current and future BlueHalo CUAS-RF products and capabilities
Optimization of current SkyView Software/RF architecture
You’re required to have this:

Overview:
Do you want to build an impactful career to change the world for the better?
Geosyntec has an exciting opportunity for a Early-Career Engineer preferrably in our Santa Barbara, CA office or our Ventura, Costa Mesa, Los Angeles, Arcadia, or Long Beach, California office, working for our contaminated site assessment & remediation practice. The position will have the opportunity to apply academic knowledge to real-world situations while also learning the business skills needed for a successful consulting career.

Geosyntec is an innovative, international engineering and consulting firm serving private and public-sector clients to address new ventures and complex problems involving our environment, natural resources, and civil infrastructure. Our engineers, scientists, technical and project employees serve our clients from offices across the world. Ranked by ENR as one of the top environmental engineering design firms, Geosyntec is internationally known for its technical leadership, broad experience, and exceptional client service.

We invest in our people. Each employee is unique, and your career at Geosyntec will be too. We offer competitive pay and benefits, and well-being programs to support you and your family.

To Learn More Visit: http://www.geosyntec.com/careers/.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Fieldwork such as ambient air, soil vapor, soil and groundwater sampling, drilling and contractor oversight, and remediation system O&M;
Chemical data and contaminant fate & transport evaluation;
Investigation of the vapor intrusion pathway;
Groundwater and soil remedy evaluation, cost estimation, design calculations, and implementation;
Vapor intrusion mitigation system design and implementation;
Aquifer testing and hydrogeologic data analyses;
Environmental due diligence, regulatory compliance services, and permitting;
Data analysis, including preparing maps, tables, and figures; and
Technical reports, letters, memoranda, plans, specifications, and proposals.
Training: This position requires 40-hour OSHA health and safety, first aid, and CPR training and medical monitoring, paid for by the firm. We also offer professional development opportunities including in-house seminars, webinars, and mentoring, that allow our professionals to build the technical and business skills necessary to become successful consultants.
Fieldwork: Up to 80%
Overnight travel: Up to 40%
Education and Licensure:
Bachelors degree in civil or chemical engineering or related engineering field. (required)
Advanced degree in the same. (preferred)
Skills, Experience and Qualifications:
Prior internship or work experience in environmental consulting up to 2 years; or equivalent combination of education and experience. (preferred)
Regular field work and overnight travel. (required)
Health & Safety training, medical monitoring, and client-driven drug and background testing. (required)
Valid U.S. driver’s license and a satisfactory driving record for business travel. (required)
Below are the potential compensation ranges that we in good faith believe are applicable for this role at the time of this posting and are only applicable for jobs to be performed in the specified California locations below. The typical base salary range for this position is just one component of Geosyntec’s total compensation package for employees. Based on state and federal requirements, this position may be hourly and overtime-eligible or salaried eligible for straight-time overtime. Actual compensation will be determined based on education, experience, skill set and location.
Minimum: $70,625 /year / Maximum: $104,230/year (Los Angeles, Long Beach, Arcadia)
Minimum: $67,555/year / Maximum: $99,700/year (Costa Mesa, Santa Barbara)
Minimum: $64,485 /year / Maximum: $95,170/year (Ventura)
We offer a comprehensive benefits package including, paid holidays, vacation, sick, and personal paid time off, medical, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance, 401(k), and other benefits to eligible employees.

Job_Description:
CALLING ALL PROJECT ENGINEERS IN THE CIVIL SPACE!!!
We are looking to add a project engineer engineer to our team full time in Des Moines, IA specializing in the solid waste industry. Responsibilities include client facing and problem solving to complete projects in a timely manner, oversee projects with a team to provide engineering support to our current and future projects within solid waste primarily focused on landfill and landfill gas systems. Other responsibilities include permitting and design for solid waste facilities, overseeing and monitoring construction operations and conducting permits for air quality.
Our operation has expanded and we have newly opened and office on the outskirts of West Des Moines, open space concept with design, project management, and other supportive teams. You will periodically be in the field meeting with construction team and clients on site, as well as in office collaborating with design team and other project managers. From head leadership to entry level engineers there is a wide variety of experience in this office to collaborate with. Job_Description:
FIVES NORTH AMERICAN COMBUSTION, INC.

Fives North American Combustion, Inc. is hiring a permanent, fulltime Controls Engineer to join our team in Cleveland, OH.
Fives North American Combustion (HQ: Cleveland) is a dynamic subsidiary of the renowned Fives Group (HQ: Paris). Boasting over 100 years of groundbreaking contributions to industrial combustion, we stand at the forefront of thermal process engineering and manufacturing across the globe.
From designing and manufacturing cutting-edge burners and industrial furnaces to installing and servicing combustion systems, we span industries including aluminum, steel, forging, incineration, oil and gas, mineral, paper, glass, and food. Our fusion of innovative energy and expertise yields unparalleled technology, breakthrough products and performance-enhancing solutions.
Fueling our success is a firm belief in innovation through collaboration. At Fives, we are driven by a common calling, to prove that industry can do it! Join us as we work together to make industry an answer to technological, environmental, social, and economic challenges of our time and to make your career an adventure in shaping the future of industrial excellence.

At Fives, we all have a part to play in achieving our common mission. Your role will be to:
Create controls solutions for our engineered combustion system projects with minimal supervision
Apply control concepts (e.g., feedback control, PID) to heating and other processes
Apply safety design concepts
Develop and program the control software and visualization/data systems
Generate supporting documentation for the control system, including written narratives
Support control systems through their lifecycle (conception, development, commissioning, future support)
Maintain a firm understanding of combustion and heating related processes
Maintain expertise with current hardware and software automation offerings from Rockwell and Siemens
Apply applicable combustion, safety, and electrical standards to control system design
May select control panel components, develop bills of material, create and manage schematic drawings and release the documentation to manufacturing
Act as the subject matter expert on the control solution
Manage multiple simultaneous projects
Occasional travel to customer facilities for support may be required
Other duties as assigned

If this is you, come join us!
Bachelor’s degree in electrical, controls engineering or another related field.
Strong working knowledge of industrial programmable automation systems, tools, and components
Programming of industrial programmable controllers (PLC, PAC)
Programming of visualization and data systems
Industrial networking knowledge, including Ethernet networks
Control of industrial processes (temperatures, pressures, etc.)
Application of industrial instrumentation
Reading and interpreting electrical schematics and P&IDs
Thorough understanding of control reliability and safety
Though not required, the following are a strong plus:
Combustion experience and working knowledge of NFPA 85, 86, and 87
Strong working knowledge of other programming languages and databases
Experience and strong working knowledge of NFPA79 and UL508A
Experience and working knowledge of AutoCAD and AutoCAD Electrical
Experience with safety instrumented systems

Benefits
Hybrid/Work remotely on Mondays and Fridays
Comprehensive benefits package featuring coverage for the majority of health insurance premiums, along with company-paid life insurance, short-term disability (STD), and long-term disability (LTD)
401(k): 6% match and immediate vesting
Paid vacation, sick and volunteer time
12 paid holidays
Parental leave
Tuition reimbursement
Training and development
Company social events
Work/life balance
… and more!

Why come to Fives North American Combustion?
We are visionaries, challengers, collaborators and relationship-builders. We are passionate and proud of our history, products and services. We take care of each other, our customers, and our communities simply because it is the right thing to do.
Collectively, we solve problems for companies around the world and offer the highest quality products and services to make our customers and our workforce successful. Our team is made up of motivated, intelligent and engaged creators who work hard, play hard, and are committed to minimizing the environmental impact of fossil fuels. #ZR

Industry can do it with you!

Job_Description:
Why Join Altec?
Develop the next generation of equipment in a company that is a leader in the utility equipment industry. Join a focused engineering team where you can have an immediate impact in developing Altec's next world-class product.
Take a Career Step
Work in a facility that manufactures, assembles, and tests its own designs.
Support sales in a direct business-to-business customer relationship.
Altec Inc. is a financially stable company with a history of continuous growth, providing a pool of resources to draw on for support and with a focus on continuous improvement.
Advancement opportunities exist, with relocation potential around the country.
Responsibilities
As a Product Design Engineer, you will have the opportunity to further explore many facets of machine design. The challenge of building products which are lighter, faster, and capable of lifting greater payloads is more important now than ever. Practice concept engineering, perform Finite Element Analysis as a tool for design validation, oversee lifecycle testing to ensure design integrity, and more.
Structural Steel, Aluminum & Composite Material Design
Hydraulic Systems Design & Component Selection
Finite Element Analysis
Classical Engineering Analysis
Design Validation Test Authority
Failure Mode Analysis
Creation & Utilization of Supporting Design Tools
Advanced Technology Integration
Qualifications:
ABET EAC certified Bachelors Degree in Engineering or a Master's Degree in Engineering required; excludes Technology degrees
Excellent analytical, verbal, and written communication skills required
Must be able to work with team members and work with minimal supervision
Preferences: Experience in Industrial Automation (CODESYS), a manufacturing environment, Experience with New Product Development, Experience in hydraulics and hydraulic control systems, Experience in structural design, Knowledge of SolidWorks, Knowledge of FEA (Finite Element Analysis), Leadership or Supervisory Experience, Professional Engineer License, Mechanical Engineer, Agricultural Engineer, Hydraulics, Structural Design
Responsibilities
Maintain software products and manage partnerships with software suppliers to ensure product functionality, reliability, serviceability.
Manage the coordinated release of software updates and associated tracking within the production plant.
Plan, coordinate, and support field campaigns as required.
Manage coordinated changes to product designs and manufacturing processes in conjunction with local teams.
Design, modify, and/or apply components and systems using prudent engineering methods and techniques to meet specified technical objectives on time.
Analyze and solve complex product design, application, manufacturing, installation, and service problems.
Create unique original product designs which may be patentable.
Develop and execute experiments to validate and qualify new design solutions.
Direct other engineers and technical support personnel to carry out specific design tasks.
Analyze competitive product designs and report findings.
Communicates directly with Customers and Suppliers on issues of technical specifications, product design and product performance as needed.
Implement defect prevention procedures or processes in product design or application.
Analyze new technologies for potential application in next generation products.
Support quality improvements in all facets of the company's business.
Collaborate with various teams within the organization to solve technical problems and identify improvement opportunities.
Should the selected candidate meet the qualifications of a more experienced level in the career path, the job level may be adjusted.
Benefits
Altec offers a competitive salary that rewards performance and dedication, along with a comprehensive benefits package that includes:
Medical, Dental, Vision and Prescription Drug Program
Retirement 401(k) Traditional or Roth Program Options with Company Match
Vacation and Holidays
Parental Leave
Short Term and Long Term Disability Leave
Flexible Spending Accounts
Tuition Assistance Program
Employee Assistance and Mental Health/Substance Abuse Program
Life Insurance, Accidental Death and Dismemberment Insurance
Supplemental Insurance including Hospital Indemnity, Critical Illness and Accident Insurance
Additional Wellness Programs and Rewards Available

Job_Description:
Johnson, Mirmiran & Thompson is a dynamic, 100% employee-owned consulting firm of more than 2,000 professionals that provides a full range of multi-disciplined engineering, architecture, information technology, and related services to public agencies and private clients throughout the United States. JMT is currently ranked #59 on Engineering News-Record’s list of the Top 500 Design Firms.

Position Summary: JMT is seeking a motivated Water Resources Design Engineer with 6-10 years of design experience to join the Trenton, NJ group. The Design Engineer will perform various design and permitting tasks in conjunction and with the oversight of senior design engineers. The successful candidate will be well-versed across the water resources discipline with demonstrated design experience in drainage, erosion and sediment control, stormwater management design, H&H modeling, and permitting with the supporting capabilities to perform a variety of design tasks in the civil engineering and environmental permitting field. U.S. Residency Required.

Essential Functions and Responsibilities
Candidates must be capable of working on multiple projects in a dynamic, fast-paced team-oriented environment. Excellent written and oral communication skills are a must.
Candidates to be familiar with Federal, State and local jurisdiction design standards and permitting regulations is required.
Candidates to be capable of completing design tasks including, but are not limited to, the development of roadway and site grading plans, drainage design, stormwater management design, erosion and sedimentation control, construction staging and sequencing plans, watershed studies, hydrologic and hydraulic analysis, and design/inspection of traditional and innovative green stormwater infrastructure and SWM BMPs in both urban and rural environments.
Candidates to complete assignments will be performed through a working knowledge of applicable design criteria, regulatory requirements, and standards and processes.
Candidates to be capable of coordinating with contractors, outside consultants, government agencies, and JMT staff from multiple locations and technical disciplines is expected.

Nonessential Functions and Responsibilities
Perform other related duties as assigned



Required Experience
Bachelors of Science in Civil or Environmental Engineering with emphasis in Water Resources
6-10 years of experience in Land Development or Water Resources Engineering
Professional Engineer (preferred)
Hydrologic Modeling experience using TR55 / TR20 and Rational Methodologies
Hydraulic Modeling experience using HEC-RAS, HY-8, HydroCAD, Pondpack, StormCAD
Stormwater Management design experience
Erosion and Sediment Control design experience
Microstation Inroads S&S, ORD, AutoCAD Civil 3D design and drafting experience
Contract Document preparation including Plans, Specifications and Cost Estimates
Proficient in MS Office Software

Preferred Experience
Knowledge of New Jersey Department of Transportation design standards and the New Jersey Department of Environmental Protection Permitting processes
2-D Modeling experience using SWMM or comparable model
Experience with ORD SUDA
Experience with advanced hydraulic modeling.

Working Conditions
Work is performed within a general office environment 75% of the time. Work is generally sedentary in nature but may require occasional standing and walking. Lighting and temperature are adequate and there are no hazardous or unpleasant conditions caused by noise, dust, etc. within the office environment.
Field work is required on occasion where work may be conducted outside in heat/cold, wet/humid, and dry/arid conditions. Some lifting (up to 25 lbs) may be required as needed.
Applicant will need a valid driver license and mode of transportation to occasionally conduct site visits, field investigations, or inspections.

JMT is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/Disability/Vet/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity, and we are proud to be building an inclusive and diverse workforce.

Job_Description:
Company Overview:
At Relativity Space, we have two audacious goals: to build the next great commercial launch company with Terran R and to become America's leading force in additive manufacturing innovation. Both contribute to our long-term vision of creating humanity’s industrial base on Mars, paving the way for interplanetary life to expand the possibilities of the human experience. This journey begins right here on Earth – where we design, build, and fly rockets to deliver customer payloads to orbit. Terran R, our medium-to-heavy lift reusable rocket, fulfills the growing demand for launch capacity, thanks to our iterative approach that accelerates design, testing, and development while minimizing costs. While our groundbreaking research and development in 3D printing pushes the boundaries of large-scale additive manufacturing.
Your journey with us is more than just a job – it’s an opportunity to shape the future of aerospace technology, additive manufacturing, and the human experience alongside a community of passionate, creative individuals. Join us on this extraordinary journey, as we work together to transform our vision into reality.
Team:
This role is on the Engine Systems & Test Team. Our work spans simulation & software tools; system-level architecture, requirements, and interfaces; component & integrated system hot-fire testing; and more. We collaborate closely with component engineers, our manufacturing team, our Stennis test team, and our Cape launch team to deliver engines that will successfully propel the Terran R rocket to orbit. We strive for continuous improvement and support the development of our technical hardware and human teammates alike.
What you’ll do:
Build software to develop rocket engines faster. At Relativity, we believe in-house tools are key to our development velocity and maintaining high standards in a startup environment. In this role, you’ll interface daily with your customers and conceptualize brand new tools in addition to developing and maintaining existing tooling. You’ll build tooling that automates routine tasks, freeing up your teammates time to solve hard problems. You’ll interface with manufacturing, mechanical, electrical, and software engineers to propose new packages and methodologies to remove barriers that slow the team down. You’ll work on tools that span the entire engine lifecycle from design through operations. To be successful in this role, you should be relentlessly focused on the needs of your customers, regularly checking in and confirming that your tools meet their needs. You should be excited to learn from engineers in other disciplines about their needs, and willing to explain both the abilities and limits of software tools. You should be comfortable reaching out across the organization to drive big tasks forward with an interdisciplinary team. You should also be a self-starter who is always looking for ways to improve yourself & learn more about the hardware that generates the inputs for your software. Along with these high expectations comes the opportunity to have a significant influence on a fast-growing startup company and to make rapid professional gains in an environment that encourages growth and risk. This role requires an average of 15% travel to our test & launch sites and may occasionally require shifted schedules or weekend work for critical milestones.
What you need to know:
Strong full-stack software development fundamentals. Strong command of Python is a must
Clear evidence of ownership, problem-solving skills, and effective team collaboration from school or work experience
Customer focus and a passion for building usable tools for highly technical users
Demonstrated drive to deliver on ambitious schedules, even and especially if unconventional & creative solutions are necessary to do so
Bachelor’s degree in a science, engineering, technology, or mathematics field
Nice to haves but not required:
Experience with C++, Rust, and/or Javascript
Experience building software that interacts with the physical world (sensors, actuators, manufacturing processes, etc.)
Familiarity with fluid mechanics or thermodynamics
Prior exposure to hardware development
Relativity Space offers competitive salary and equity, a generous vacation policy, an annual L&D stipend and more!
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

The below-range represents Relativity Space’s current good-faith pay scale for this role. Relativity Space reserves the right to modify or update this range at any time.

Compensation is only one part of our entire total rewards package. To see some of the benefits & perks we offer, please visit here: https://px.sequoia.com/relativityspace
Hiring Range:
$121,000—$156,000 USD

Job_Description:
At Integrated Water Services (IWS) WE MAKE WATER BETTER! For over 20 years, we’ve been providing our customers with solutions to manage drinking and wastewater to protect people and the environment. We serve clients ranging from real estate developers, governments, and food and beverage and industrial manufacturers.

We’re seeking a PE licensed Design Engineer who will design state of the art water and wastewater treatment solutions that optimize performance, reduce environmental impact, and ensure the longevity of water and wastewater systems.

As a member of the Technical & Digital Services (TDS) group you’ll share the vision of being a pioneer in leveraging cutting-edge technologies and digital solutions to redefine efficiency, precision, and sustainability in water and wastewater infrastructure. We envision a future where technology seamlessly integrates with engineering prowess to create smarter, more resilient systems.

Responsibilities
Prepare preliminary and final designs for complex projects.
Translate customer requirements into functional system designs and diagrams.
Review project specifications to ensure that design and documentation align with the requirements.
Assist with the preparation of requests for proposals and evaluation of proposals.
Conduct system calculations from preliminary to final design
Provide markups for plans and lead cost estimates.
Coordinate with project staff, other disciplines, subconsultants, clients, and reviewers to ensure accuracy and quality of work.
Manage and maintain project documentation, including meeting project schedules, budgets, and scope.
Mentor junior staff with technical and professional development.

Qualifications
Bachelors degree in engineering (civil or other related field)
Licensed Professional Engineer in one or more States.
Minimum of 5 years of proven experience in the water and wastewater treatment industry.
Experience with general construction, utilities, and/or water and wastewater treatment plants preferred.
Ability to read and understand civil, mechanical, structural, and electrical drawings.
Ability to create process & instrumentation diagrams (P&IDs).
Proficient with CAD and other design software platforms.

Location: Hybrid. Preferred location Bulverde, TX or Austin, TX. A fully remote work arrangement may be considered for the right candidate.

Total Rewards Package includes:
Competitive salary and benefits including:
Medical, Dental, Vision, STD, LTD
PTO
401k
An opportunity to grow your skills and your career

Base Salary: $90k-130k annually*

The provided base salary range is used nationally. The rate offered is compliant with federal/local regulations and may vary by experience, certification/education, market conditions, location, etc.

We work to solve our customers’ water problems. We design and build the most efficient and effective plants utilizing our own best in class technologies. And we do it all with great people like you! There is nothing better than knowing that what you do creates a better future. Come join us as we make water better, one drop at a time!

IWS is an equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate based on marital status, race, color, creed, gender, sex, religion, national origin, gender identity, age, veteran status, union affiliation, physical or mental disability, citizenship status, or sexual orientation.

Job_Description:
Building a career at Granite may be the most valuable thing you could do...
Are you interested in the opportunity to work for an industry-leading company that will give you the experience and exposure you need to build your career and personal brand? If so, then you’ve come to the right place!
General Summary
This position is responsible for coordinating an environmental program using established guidelines, including all aspects of the permitting and compliance processes, provides engineering solutions to meet environmental needs, and leadership on environmental matters in a manner consistent with company policies and procedures.
Essential Job Accountabilities
Obtain all environmental permits necessary for the operation of quarries, sand and gravel, asphalt and other related operations to ensure compliance.
Provide Engineering solutions to meet to meet location environmental needs.
Coordinate with business unit personnel at multiple facilities including developing training programs to ensure compliance with all local, state, and federal regulations
Maintain an environmental compliance database which coordinates compliance reports to agencies or parties, coordinates monitoring to meet permit conditions, and brings all worksite facilities into compliance with environmental laws.
Maintain an Environmental Management System (EMS) which coordinates legal requirements and compliance tasks, establishes environmental objectives and targets, determines roles and responsibilities for environmental activities, and maintains a document and record system.
Identify and monitor environmentally significant issues and advise management on the appropriate action to help develop and maintain Granite’s reputation as an environmental leader.
Assist with solving technical problems and develop solutions to meet environmental requirements.
Education
Bachelor’s degree in Environmental Engineering, or other related engineering field required

Work Experience
0-2 years related work experience preferred

Strong public speaking and ability to communicate with management.

Physical Demands
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to stand (for up to 8 hours), walk, sit and use hands to operate a computer keyboard. The employee is occasionally required to reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, and ability to adjust focus. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Ability to abide by Granite’s Code of Conduct on a daily basis.
A team player.
Our Benefits at a Glance:
Building tomorrow starts with you, and Granite knows that you can excel only if we support you in and out of the workplace. That is why we offer a broad benefits package that includes paid holidays, sick leave, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, disability insurance, flexible spending plans, as well as special programs for musculoskeletal health, mental wellness, and more.

Salaried employees may choose from two PPO medical plans through Anthem BlueCross, including our most popular plan, for which 100% of the premium is paid by Granite for eligible employees and dependents. Employees can also opt into a Health Savings Account (HSA) or a Flexible Spending Account (FSA).

As part of our investment in your future outside of the workplace, Granite provides a 100% match on the first 6% of eligible compensation that salaried employees defer into their 401(k) plans, which vests immediately.

Job_Description:
OCI Nitrogen Iowa (OCI) is looking for a Senior Instrumentation & Controls (I&C) Engineer to join our Maintenance team in Wever, Iowa. The Senior I&C Engineer is responsible for developing, installing, managing, and maintaining equipment which is used to monitor and control engineering systems, machinery, and processes. The primary objective of this role is to ensure that these systems and processes are operating effectively, efficiently, and safely, while simultaneously ensuring all control systems adhere to Industry Best Practices. This individual ensures safety instrumented systems and critical controls are compliant with PSM.
As a Senior I&C Engineer, you will:
Assist I/E maintenance team in troubleshooting field instruments such as pressure, temperature, level, flow measuring devices, analyzers, and control valves.
Assist I/E maintenance team in troubleshooting Electrical equipment including switch gears, VFD, MCC, UPS, electrical control systems, etc.
Play a major engineering role in electrical and instrumentation projects including inhouse projects and modifications and outsourced projects.
Prepare and approve electrical and instrumentation specifications and drawings, including equipment/device data sheets, loop diagrams, instrument index, wiring diagrams, single line diagrams, panel wiring diagrams.
Specify, size, and select instrument devices such as flow elements, temperature elements, thermowells, control valves, level measuring devices, analyzers, gas detectors, instrument cables, instrument panels, etc.
Assist electrical engineers with specifying and selecting electrical equipment such as switch gears, transformers, VFDs, MCCs, electrical cables, electrical control panels, etc.
Collaborate actively with DCS engineers to identify I/O points in DCS/PLC systems for new field instrument additions.
Lead and participate in management of change “MOC” process for electrical and instrumentation. MOC process will require I/E engineers to review, create and update I/E engineering documents.
Review, prepare and approve electrical and instrumentation preventive and predictive maintenance programs. improve existing plans or develop new ones as needed.
Lead and participate in Root Cause Analysis for electrical and instrumentation incidents, provide technical solutions to avoid repeating incidents.
Liaison with manufacturers and vendors to select right electrical and instrument equipment and devices.
Lead and play major role in evaluating and improving reliability of electrical and instrument equipment, devices and systems.
Work with vendors and maintenance team on complex analytical equipment including CEMS to ensure reliable and accurate measurement.
Mentor Junior I&E engineers and participate in training of technicians on electrical and instrumentation technical subjects.
Assess, identify, and recommend spare parts for electrical and instrument equipment based on vendor recommendations, probability of failure and system criticality.
Manage SIF test activities when SIF system validation is required.
Review P&ID drawings to ensure logics and control philosophy properly reflected.
Participate actively in ongoing development of safety improvement plans and training of staff.
All other duties and responsibilities as assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS
Education
Minimum bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering.
Experience and Skills
10+ years’ engineering/maintenance experience in chemical industry or refining environment in engineering position. Fertilizer manufacturing experience a plus. Knowledge of engineering standards in oil and gas/chemical industries, such as API, ISA, IEC, NEC,
NFPA, etc.
Experience in engineering firms, including basic and detail engineering a plus.
Knowledge and experience in DCS, ESD, PLC hardware and software. Yokogawa DCS, PLC and HMI programming a plus.
Knowledge of Safety Instrumented System (SIS) standards and applications
Experience in SAP or similar ERP programs a plus.
Strong knowledge of field instrument selection, application, calibration, troubleshooting, including analyzers.
Proficient in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, TEAMS, PowerPoint).
Physical and Work Environment Requirements
Ability to work outdoors in all weather conditions.
Bending, kneeling, lifting up to 50 pounds.
Wearing a respirator when/where required to perform inspections/job duties.
Ability to climb straight ladders. Some work may require heights more than 100 feet.
Confined space entry may be required.
Wearing hearing protection within high level noise areas as required.
Must be willing to be available 24/7 on short notice to support plant operations.
Maintain a valid driver’s license. Always ensure HR has a copy of a current, valid license on file.
Company Profile
OCI Global is a leading global producer and distributor of nitrogen products and methanol providing sustainable solutions to agricultural and industrial customers around the world. Our production capacity spans four continents and comprises approximately 16.1 million metric tons per year of nitrogen fertilizers, methanol, diesel exhaust fluid, melamine, and other nitrogen products. We are headquartered in the Netherlands and listed on Euronext in Amsterdam. We are proud to have cultivated a strong community focused identity as a local employer with 3,600 employees around the world. Our employment strategy has resulted in a diverse global workforce encompassing 25 nationalities located in ten countries, with diverse ethnicities, religious beliefs, cultures, orientations, ages, and other traits working together respectfully and with a shared sense of purpose.
OCI is an equal opportunity employer that recruits, hires, trains, and promotes regardless of race, color, age, disability, sex, national origin, or religion. We value diversity in our workforce and in the communities we serve.
OCI offers a comprehensive, first-class benefits package starting the first day of the month following an employee’s hire date.
Medical insurance
Prescription drug insurance
Dental insurance
Vision insurance
Life insurance
Disability insurance
401(k) program with company matching.
Paid holidays.
Paid time off (PTO)

While this is intended to be an accurate reflection of the current job, OCI Nitrogen North America reserves the right to revise or change job duties and responsibilities as business needs arise. Job_Description:
This Opportunity
WSP is currently initiating a search for a Vice President Geotechnical & Tunneling Engineer for our Orlando, FL office. Be involved in projects with our Geotechnical & Tunneling Team, take on a leadership role, and be a part of a growing organization that meets our client’s objectives and solves their challenges. The position relies heavily on an ability to interact with clients, team leadership skills, and technical knowledge.
Responsibilities for this role include building our business and teams with client engagement, business development, managing and providing support on large, diverse projects with services that include an emphasis on geohazard identification, field reconnaissance, managing subsurface investigation programs, engineering design, and construction support.
Your Impact
Provide proactive and strategic leadership for the geotechnical engineering discipline, offering direction, expertise, and support to ensure project and work site deliverables are successfully achieved.
Manage a team of geotechnical and tunneling engineers including tracking active projects and budgets, delegating tasks, coordinating across disciplines within project teams, coordinating with subconsultants, reviewing work, and providing professional guidance and mentoring.
Manage proposal efforts; prepare bid documents including design, schedule, cost estimate, risk registry, etc.
T rack business development opportunities, both internally and externally.
Perform professional geotechnical engineering work including design, subsurface investigations, soil foundation engineering, settlement analysis, soil erosion, lateral earth pressures, geological hazards, underground water, slope stability, and operations to determine conformance with applicable rules, standards, construction, or operating permits for commercial, industrial, building, environmental, infrastructure, and transportation projects.
Apply high-level geotechnical engineering techniques and processes to identify improvements for various infrastructure project phases including concept development, preliminary design, final design, procurement, construction, and operation.
Develop construction plans, specifications, and cost estimates; preparing construction safety and phasing plans, and updating infrastructure layout plans that require coordination with owners, other disciplines, sub-consultants, and clients.
Interact with regulatory agencies, subcontractors, drillers, and clients in a confident and professional manner.
Who You Are

Bachelors Degree in Civil Engineering with Geotechnical Engineering focus
12+ years of relevant post education experience in engineering and geotechnical design.

Exercise responsible and ethical decision-making regarding company funds, resources and conduct and adhere to WSP"s Code of Conduct and related policies and procedures
Effective self-leadership with attention to detail, results orientation, and managing multiple priorities in a dynamic work environment.
Ability to learn new techniques, perform multiple tasks simultaneously, work independently, and comply with company policies.
Proven track record of upholding workplace safety and ability to abide by WSP’s health, safety and drug/alcohol and harassment policies.

Master’s Degree in Geotechnical Engineering.
20+ years of relevant experience in geotechnical, tunneling and underground engineering

Job_Description:
Quality Engineer II
Horicon, WI - Full Time
Productive Resources (www.productiveresources.com) is seeking a candidate to be part of our engineering team at John Deere's facility in Horicon, Wisconsin. As a member of our team, the selected candidate will provide quality planning, control, and improvement support for product development teams, manufacturing engineering, supply management, and manufacturing and/or distribution organizations to assure John Deere product quality meets the customers' expectations.
This is a full-time position that is indefinite in duration with the opportunity of professional growth, and additional opportunities within our organization.

Investigate quality issues related to product and processes, gather, and analyze data to determine root cause.
Provide work direction to inspectors and auditors on containment, quality procedures and tools to monitor critical processes.

Job_Description:
Givler Engineering has an exciting opportunity for an individual with a passion for civil engineering to work on grading and drainage plans and retrofits for building sites. If you possess strong construction and math skills and a desire to contribute to infrastructure development, consider joining our dynamic team!

As a Graduate Civil Drainage Engineer, your primary responsibility is to assist in the design and implementation of drainage systems for various civil engineering projects. Our firm's services include hydrologic and hydraulic modeling, drainage system layout and wastewater retrofitting, for private and public sector clients such as private homeowners, community associations, and municipalities. This is an exciting opportunity to gain hands-on experience in a professional and collaborative environment.

Position Summary:
Will conduct site visits and review surveys to assess drainage needs and collect relevant data to assist in the design and analysis of drainage systems, including sewers and culverts.

Primary duties:
Preparing technical drawings, plans and specifications for drainage systems.
Hydrologic and Hydraulic (H&H) modeling.
Assisting in the preparation of cost estimates and project proposals.
Conducting research and staying up to date with industry standards, codes and regulations related to drainage engineering.
Assisting with the preparation of reports and presentations for clients and regulatory agencies.
Collaborating with other team members, including architects, surveyors, contractors and clients.

Minimum Requirements:
Bachelors degree in civil engineering or related field from an ABET university.
Knowledge of civil engineering principles and practices.
0-2 years of prior related drainage design experience.
Familiarity with construction plans, specifications, and estimates.
Fundamentals of Engineering (EIT) certification or ability to obtain one within 6 months required.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills are essential as you will be dealing with complex hydraulic and hydrological calculations.
Proficiency in CAD software (AutoCAD, Revit, or similar) is necessary.
Excellent attention to detail and accuracy in work.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment.
Effective communication skills, both verbal and written.
Ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize workload.

Don't meet all of the above criteria? That's OK! Apply anyway!

Preferred Experience:
Familiarity with ArcGIS
Familiarity with coordinate systems
Familiarity with one or more of the following:
Autodesk Civil 3D
HEC-RAS
PondPack
FlowMaster

Competencies for Success:
Adaptability: As a graduate engineer, facing new challenges will be the norm and you must be able to quickly adjust to new situations and be flexible in your approach. Must have the ability to show resilience when facing setbacks.
Positive Attitude: Approach your work with enthusiasm, optimism, and a can-do attitude. Our EITs and PEs on staff can teach you the rest.
Effective Communication: Express yourself clearly and professionally both verbally and in writing. Good communication also includes active listening and following instructions accurately.
Willingness to Learn: As you use your best efforts to accomplish work assignments, be open to receiving feedback. Feel comfortable with asking questions if instructions require further explanation or clarification. We are friendly and want to help you succeed. All the above are the ingredients necessary for you to acquire new skills and knowledge as you begin your career.

All applicants are considered for all positions without regard to race, religion, color, sex, gender, sexual orientation, pregnancy, age, national origin, ancestry, physical/mental disability, medical condition, military/veteran status, genetic information, marital status, ethnicity, alienage, or any other protected classification, in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws.

Job_Description:

ABOUT BROADBENT & ASSOCIATES, INC.
Founded in 1987, we are an environmental remediation, water resource, and civil engineering firm. We provide professional services throughout the United States to energy companies, mining operations, agricultural companies, municipalities, private industries, governmental agencies, public and private utilities, and developers. Our mission is to build long-term client relationships by providing sound scientific solutions to comprehensive resource management challenges. We're very client-focused with a commitment to providing services in a time-efficient and cost-effective manner.
We take care of our customers AND employees like family. Our ability to hire and retain long-term skilled key personnel has significantly contributed to our success. We offer competitive pay, opportunities for personal growth, and a great work environment with a sense of camaraderie.
A DAY IN THE LIFE OF A STAFF SCIENTIST/ENGINEER
As a Staff Scientist or Engineer, you are the backbone of our business. Your hard work ensures that we deliver for our clients. Under the supervision of a Project Manager, you provide support on a wide range of environmental and mine site projects including: Soil and groundwater characterization, remediation system operation and maintenance, water and wastewater treatment facility monitoring, water resources activities, and phase 1 Environmental Site Assessments. Your primary job function will be to support the Elko, NV office with document preparation. You will support field work activities as needed to drive project execution and ensure that appropriate health and safety procedures are being followed.
People skills are essential as you interact regularly with contractors, regulators, and clientele. Though a lot of time is spent in the Elko, NV office, preparing project reports and completing routine administrative tasks, you are also responsible to conduct field activities such as seeps and spring monitoring, well sampling, and soil collection. Collected field data is summarized in reports and presented to Project Managers. Our mission is to complete work safely, on-time, and on budget which makes our clients happy and provides a great sense of accomplishment to our staff.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS FOR ENGINEER
Bachelors degree in Engineering: Civil or Environmental
0 - 2 Years work experience
Technical writing competency
Strong technical and computer skills
Self-starter, quick learner and effective communicator
Ability to work individually and as part of a team
Ability to work consecutive long days in the field under varying adverse weather conditions (hot, cold, windy, and sometimes wet)
Are you detail-oriented? Do you have technical writing and research skills? Are you a problem-solver? Are you organized and able to effectively prioritize multiple tasks? Do you have excellent communication skills? Are you energetic, self-sufficient, and motivated? Are you collaborative and team-oriented? If so, you might just be perfect for this position!
STAFF ENGINEER WORK SCHEDULE
This full-time Staff position typically works Monday - Thursday with occasional traveling and Friday/weekend work
READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?
We understand your time is valuable and that is why we have a very quick and easy application process. If you feel that you would be right for this position, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application. We look forward to meeting you!

Broadbent is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, gender identity or any other factor protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.

Job_Description:
Requisition ID: 21672
Location: Westminster, US, 80021
As the Project Engineer Senior, you will manage the Engineering activities related to design for utility-scale renewables projects (wind, solar, and energy storage) throughout the US and Canada and serve as a main point of contact.

Every day, you provide engineering technical input into projects at various stages (from feasibility/ preliminary to detailed design), coordinate Engineering design efforts with EPC or external consultants to review and comment on design submittals in coordination with support from ENGIE subject matter experts (Civil and Electrical) and manage and ensure all deliverables meet Project specifications. Additionally, you manage external engineering firms, subcontractors as well as various engineering disciplines (civil, electrical, structural, etc.) to achieve the highest level of engineering and design for project execution and actively identify all critical risks, issues and impacts of the project specifically the adequate application of and adherence to corporate health & safety and environmental requirements.

Review/monitor contractors’ progress and monitor the progress relating to key project milestones
Internal coordination with Development, Engineering, Permitting, GIS and Land group
Assist procurement in running RFPs and managing the process to sub-contractors
Remain up to date on new technologies and regulatory conditions including utility requirements, vendor qualifications, industry best practices, safety standards, and relevant standards development
Travel to perform site assessments, design review meetings and due diligence of development engineering throughout the USA and Canada in support of site evaluation and development and permitting activities

What You’ll Bring
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering which you completed courses in civil engineering or electrical engineering or comparable technical knowledge through demonstrated work experience with a solid understanding of power generation plants.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in similar positions, managing renewable energy projects and producing standards, specifications, and documentation.
Experience and understanding of the owner’s engineer role
Experience and understanding of technical due diligence
Experience and understanding of commercial contracts and negotiations

Additional Details
This role is eligible for our hybrid work policy
Must be available to travel domestically up to 40% of the time and with the need for some overnight trips
Must be willing and able to comply with ENGIE’s policy with respect to COVID vaccination and testing
Must be willing and able to comply with all ENGIE ethics and safety policies

Compensation
Salary Range: $96,100 – $147,660 USD annually

This represents the average expected pay range for a qualified candidate.
Actual offered salary may depend on geography, experience, industry knowledge, education, internal pay alignment, or other bona fide factors.

ENGIE complies with all federal, state, and local minimum wage laws. Actual salary offered may vary depending on geography, experience, education, internal pay alignment, or other bona fide factors.

In addition to base pay, this position is eligible for a competitive bonus / incentive plan.

Your Talent Acquisition Partner can share more specific information regarding the benefits or the salary for the position based on the work location

At ENGIE, we take your well-being seriously. Our comprehensive benefits package includes options for medical, dental, vision, life insurance, employer-paid short-term and long-term disability insurance, ESPP, generous paid time off including wellness days, holidays and leave programs. We also help you plan for retirement by offering a 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan with a company match. But that's not all – we're dedicated to the health and happiness of your entire family, offering supplemental benefits for full time employees that enhance emotional and physical well-being through all stages of life from family forming to caregiver benefits. Explore our benefits package to see how we can support you. Learn more.

Why ENGIE?
ENGIE North America isn’t just participating in the Zero-Carbon Transition, we’re leading it! Join us as we develop energy that is renewable, efficient, and accessible to everyone.

At ENGIE, our goal is to support, promote, and thrive on diversity, equity, and inclusion. We do so for the benefit of our employees, customers, products and services, and community. ENGIE is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace, and we are firmly committed to creating an equitable and inclusive environment for all employees.

We are committed to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other legally protected status.

This email address is reserved for individuals with disabilities in need of assistance and is not a means of inquiry regarding positions or application status.

The safety of our employees is our number one priority. All employees at ENGIE have both a duty and the authority to STOP WORK if unsafe acts are observed.

Job_Description:
Mechanical Engineer
About Us
Infinitum has raised the bar for a new generation of motor that is better for the planet and people. The company’s patented air core motors offer superior performance in half the weight and size, at a fraction of the carbon footprint of traditional motors, making them pound for pound the most efficient in the world. Infinitum motors open up sustainable design possibilities for the machines we rely on to be smaller, lighter and quieter, improving our quality of life while also saving energy and reducing waste. Based in Austin, Texas, Infinitum is led by a team of industry experts and pioneers. To learn more, visit goinfinitum.com.
Position: Mechanical Engineer

Location: Round Rock, TX
Job Overview:

Infinitum is looking for a full-time Mechanical Engineer to work on site in our R&D team.
Key Responsibilities:
Conduct product design and development following general design guidelines and tools including CAD programs.
Conduct calculations and analysis using closed-form methods, computer applications, and fully functional FEA and other simulation tools. Develop calculation tools for specific problems.
Support other departments and customers by addressing technical questions under general design guidelines.
Review drawings, schematics, bills of material, and other documentation necessary to manufacture, test, install, and commission products.
Create and enhance specific design guidelines by leveraging past experience and technical learning.
Assist in the development of new products by providing input on specifications, designing and building prototypes, devising validation tests, and preparing supporting documentation.
Provide input to project feasibility and cost analysis.
Execute tasks according to orders or project schedules, striving for 100% on-time completion. Provide timely reports on project status.
Participate in product improvement, productivity improvement, standardization, cost reduction, and cycle time reduction initiatives. Lead some of these initiatives.
Provide disposition to non-conformances and participate in corrective actions providing technical input based on established design guidelines.
Qualifications and Skills
Must-Have Skills:
Bachelors degree (B.S.) from a four-year college or university in Engineering or Physical Science with four to six years of related work experience, or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Master’s degree desired.
Four to six years of experience designing rotating machines, preferably electric motors and generators. Experience with permanent magnet machines is an asset.
Working knowledge of NEMA, IEEE, API, and IEC standards applicable to electric motors and generators.
Proficiency in SolidWorks.
In-depth understanding of design for manufacturability and manufacturing processes in general.
Good-to-Have Skills:
Experience using FEA software conducting stress and/or thermal analysis is an asset.
Benefits:
We have created a community at Infinitum, where everyone feels a sense of belonging and is working together to achieve our goals.
Comprehensive Health Coverage (Medical/Dental/Vision)
Short-Term & Long-Term Disability Coverage
Health Savings Account (HSA) – includes employer contributions.
Flexible Spending Account (FSA) & Limited Purpose Flexible Spending Account
401(k) – Traditional and Roth
Stock Options
Open Paid Time Off (PTO)
12 Paid Holidays
Potential Relocation Assistance
Flexible schedule – including hybrid possibilities
Company Paid Lunch on Fridays
Community Give-back Opportunities
Infinitum embraces diversity and is an equal opportunity employer.

Agency representatives, we appreciate your interest, but we've got this!
