Job_Title: Engineer- Manufacturing I (A Crew/ AM Shift)
Job_Description:
First Solar reserves the right to offer you a role most applicable to your experience and skillset.
Basic Job Functions:
Daily sustaining of product performance for key manufacturing metrics (Yield, Module Efficiency and Reliability) in timely fashion. Define problem statement and work cross-functionally for characterization of process issue, short term containment and long term prevention solution. Transfer new technology from pilot line to satellite sites.
Education/Experience:
Candidates must meet one of the following criteria to qualify:
Associate’s Degree in an engineering or similar technical discipline combined with
3 or more years of First Solar technical experience, or
6 or more years of technical work experience in a Manufacturing setting.
Bachelor’s Degree, Master’s Degree, or Ph.D. in an engineering or similar technical discipline with no experience required. Technical work experience in combination with a degree is preferred.
The following certifications and experience can be used in lieu of the above degree requirements. In each case the candidate must demonstrate skills and experience in peer training/mentorship and basic data analysis
3 or more years’ experience as a First Solar Maintenance Technician III, MET III, EPT III or Equipment Coordinator III or
Journeyman certification in a relevant technical discipline such as Machinist or Electrician combined with 5 or more years industry experience at Journeyman level or
10 or more years’ experience as a highly skilled technician/specialist in a relevant discipline. Industry-recognized certification strongly preferred.
Required Skills/Competencies:
Background in Semiconductor or PV or electronic process technology or Material Science and device physics.
Experience working with cross functional technical teams to solve problems and implement new processes and products.
Demonstrated proficiency in Statistical Data Analysis and experience using statistical software (JMP and SAS preferred).
Strong track record of effective problem-solving, and root-cause analysis.
Understanding of manufacturing engineering systems (FMEA, SPC) and structured problem-solving methods (such as DMAIC).
Prior experience with thin film deposition, thermal and wet processing preferred.
Excellent oral and written communications skills.
Desired Skills:
Understands and can apply DOE.
Understands and can apply Statistical Process Control (SPC)
Understands and can apply structured problem solving (such as DMAIC)
Experience in high volume ramp and/or new tech transfer is desired.
Project management experience preferred.
Ability to work with minimal supervision.
Essential Responsibilities:
Ensure adherence to all safety/environmental procedures.
Responsible for sustaining day-to-day production ensuring module efficiency, quality and reliability within defined SPC limits.
Ability to lead discussion with cross-functional departments and satellite sites to ensure timely communication and effective problem solving.
Design statistical experiments and Analyze data using sound statistical methodology to drive improvements and recommendations to operations of process engineering.
Understanding of and ability to interpret the results from material, physical and electrical failure analytical techniques and various compositional analysis measurements.
Support technology start-up, transfer, and ramp activities from development site to meet yield, reliability, cost, and device performance goals.
Provide engineering support for high volume manufacturing across multiple engineering departments in a global organization, working with international teams in cross functional environment .
Will support vendor discussions as needed for improvement projects, and issue resolution.
Develop and maintain process control plans.
Develop and provide training to engineering technicians, and production associates.
Reporting Relationships:
Reports to Manager, Manufacturing Engineering – Integration
This position could have direct reports.
Travel:
Domestic and international travel as required.
Estimated Salary Range:
$63,900 $91,000 Annually
US Physical Requirements:
Manufacturing & Maintenance Physical Requirements:
Will sit, stand or walk short distances for up to 12 hours per day.
Will climb stairs on an occasional basis.
Will exert up to 50 pounds of force to lift, push or pull on a seldom basis.
Will lift, push or pull up to 27 pounds on a frequent basis.
Will lift up to 51 pounds on an occasional basis, according to work instructions.
Will lift up to 37 pounds on a frequent basis.
Will push or pull up to 27 pounds of force on an occasional basis.
Will push or pull up to 10 pounds of force on a frequent basis.
Required to use hands to grasp, lift, handle, carry or feel objects repetitively on a frequent basis
20/40 vision in each eye, with or without correction, is required.
Must be able to comply with all safety standards and procedures.
May reach above shoulder heights and below the waist on a frequent basis.
May stoop, kneel, or bend, on an occasional basis.
Ability to wear personal protective equipment is required (including but not limited to; steel toed shoes, gloves, safety glasses, hearing protection, protective jacket or apron and arm guards)
All associates working on the production floor may be required to wear a respirator at any given time and thus, the ability to wear a respirator is a condition of employment and continued employment (requires little or no facial hair).


Potential candidates will meet the education and experience requirements provided on the above job description and excel in completing the listed responsibilities for this role. All candidates receiving an offer of employment must successfully complete a background check band any other tests that may be required.
Equal Opportunity Employer Statement: First Solar is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.

Job_Description:
Overview:
We are currently seeking an Electrical Engineer for our power plant facilities located in New York, NY. As an Electrical Engineer, you will provide a wide range of engineering expertise to support the company's power generation operations. The ideal candidate will have 5-10 years of experience in power generation or manufacturing with a focus on heavy electrical equipment. This role requires strong technical skills, excellent communication abilities, and experience in field engineering, troubleshooting, and project management. You will collaborate with various stakeholders within the organization and report to the Senior Director of Plant Performance.
Role and Responsibilities:
Provide expert knowledge and support for high voltage electrical equipment, such as transformers, switchgear, controls, relays, and transmission equipment
Assist with technical requests from regional ISOs (PJM, NEISO, and NYISO) and ensure NERC compliance across all facilities through oversight and management of the O&M service provider
Support solar and battery energy storage development activities, specifically in relation to electrical interconnections
Conduct project analysis, develop budgets and schedules, and create plans for the implementation of electrical projects and procurement of major equipment
Prepare engineering deliverables, equipment specifications, and construction specifications for projects and equipment procurement processes
Evaluate bids and provide recommendations for the selection of equipment and constructors
Investigate underperforming plant areas or systems, conduct root cause analysis, and propose solutions for deficiencies
Provide support for day-to-day operational activities, outage work, and new projects
Ensure compliance with safety regulations and construction codes at state and federal levels
Coordinate and provide technical assistance for SCADA, substation/plant physical, and control projects to integrate protection, control, and monitoring systems
Occasional travel to sites may be required to support various activities (~5% travel)
Qualifications:
5-10 years of experience in power generation or manufacturing with a focus on heavy electrical equipment
Knowledge of failure modes and non-destructive testing methods for power plant materials, systems, and components such as generators, transformers, cables, and insulation systems
Understanding of power plant auxiliary power distribution systems, electrical materials, and test procedures
Proficient knowledge of utility grid systems, including power generation, transmission, and distribution systems
Familiarity with protection principles and practices for transmission lines, distribution feeders, and major plant and substation equipment
Ability to interpret relaying one-lines and control schematics
Experience with electrical design schematics, SCADA systems, and station automation design for plant and substation physical electrical systems
Familiarity with relevant codes and standards, such as NEC, NESC, IEEE, NEMA, and ANSI
Experience with medium and high voltage equipment, such as transformers, switchgear, breakers, power cables, generators, motors, MCCs, power panels, and buss-work
Preferred experience in design and project execution of medium and high voltage distribution/transmission cables and transmission projects in urban environments
Excellent teamwork, written and oral communication skills, and organizational abilities
High proficiency in computer and internet use, specifically with Windows-based software programs
Engineering degree preferred, but not required
Experience with regional RTOs (NYISO, PJM, NEISO) and NERC standards is a plus

Job_Description:
We are accepting applications for the position of Town Engineer. The selected candidate, holding a valid New York State Professional Engineers License, will play a pivotal role in directing the Town Engineering Department and providing expert engineering counsel to town officials. This position requires the exercise of significant independent judgment, particularly in addressing technical engineering matters and overseeing town public works projects.

Town Engineer Responsibilities:
Coordinate construction projects across highway, sewer, and community development departments.
Review plans for new developments and inspect work in progress to ensure compliance with specifications.
Collaborate with engineering personnel, contractors, and consultants on public work projects.
Meet with town officials and residents to discuss proposed projects.
Train and manage a subordinate staff.
Analyze the environmental impact of public works projects on air and water quality, as well as noise levels.
Provide preliminary and final estimates on engineering construction.
Prepare technical reports and analyses for engineering projects.
Coordinate town facility needs, including maintenance, security, and tree removal.
Town Engineer Minimum Qualifications:
Possession of a New York State Professional Engineers License.
Four (4) years of paid full-time or part-time equivalent experience as a civil, environmental, or sustainability engineer involved in municipal public works projects, with at least one (1) year in a supervisory capacity.
Town Engineer Special Requirements:
Successful candidates must take the next Town Engineer civil service examination and be reachable on the resultant civil service list.
Applicants will undergo a pre-employment background check, drivers license verification, and drug testing.
Possession of a valid New York State motor vehicle license or a demonstration of capacity to meet transportation needs.
Our client is an equal opportunity employer. Provisional candidates must meet Civil Service minimum requirements, sit for the next examination, and be reachable on the resulting civil service list. Applications from candidates eligible for transfer or reinstatement under Civil Service Rules are welcome.

Westwood Professional Services, Inc.

Westwood Professional Services, Inc. is seeking a Project Engineer to join our Land Development team in Englewood, Colorado. Westwood has a highly experienced and dynamic team of individuals dedicated to providing high-level professional services to our clients.

Prepare site and subdivision plans for residential, commercial, and industrial projects

Holiday: Eligible for paid holidays per ESI Holiday schedule.
Sick Policy: Eligible for paid sick days. This policy is subject to change if abuse occurs. Eligible after 90 days employment.
Health Insurance: Eligible for group medical insurance after 90 days employment.
401(k) Retirement Plan: The retirement program allows you to set aside money via pre-tax deductions for your retirement. After completing one year of employment, you are eligible to become a participant in the 401 (k) retirement plan and receive a 3% employer contribution based on your salary in addition to your contributions.

Employee Assistance Program (EAP): The EAP program is a work/life benefit available to employees and their dependents at hire. The program provides confidential and free access to legal, financial, wellness and work/life resources. The program is available at hire.
Employee Discount Program: Our discount program provides employees with discounted products and services ranging from sporting events, amusement parks, hotels and shopping. The program is available at hire.
Access to 5 days of paid time off each year for volunteer service after the introductory period. The company will match your contributions or donations to any non-profit organization that 501(c)(3) tax status up to a maximum of $750.

Job_Description:
Overview:
RES is looking for a Mid-Level Water Resources Engineer with at least two (2) years of progressive experience in the water resources engineering field.
The mission: Join a growing, multi-disciplinary team of water resource engineers, restoration designers, and environmental scientists working on some of the nation’s largest lakes, rivers, streams, and wetland restoration projects. Working for RES means having a career that truly makes an impact and a job that helps make nature and communities better. Our people share a deep interest and passion for sustainability and ecological restoration. As an ever-growing company, we cultivate entrepreneurship, flexibility, and collaboration while taking a bold approach to project development. We foster a team environment while enriching individual growth.
As a member of our team, you will focus on projects for ecosystem restoration, water quality treatment, and improvements in complex watersheds, as well as solving unique ecological and hydrologic issues in various complex watersheds across Florida. Opportunities may include projects for large landscape-level flood mitigation, water storage, water supply, aquifer recharge, and nutrient reduction projects related to EPA’s Impaired Waters Rule/Total Maximum Daily Loads (TMDLs) and Florida’s Basin Management Action Plans (BMAPs).
What your day-to-day might look like?:
80% of the time, you will be modeling and designing!
As a consultant in Hydrology and Hydraulics, you will be responsible for developing and evaluating plans and criteria for a variety of engineering projects and initiatives; leading and/or assisting with feasibility and concept development for watershed level stormwater management, stream and/or wetland restoration solutions, water quality treatment technologies and BMPs; identifying errors/malfunctions/omissions and implementing corrective actions.

You will use AutoCAD, GIS, and hydrologic and hydraulic (H&H) modeling software (1D&2D) to develop H&H models and interpret results from associated models. You’ll get to flex your engineering muscles as you work on innovative designs that require developing new and/or improved techniques and procedures.

Work products are expected to be detailed, clear, and concise, so be ready to shine with your communication skills during the interview! You will be juggling several projects simultaneously, so superior attention to detail, feedback, and the ability to prioritize are paramount.
20% of the time, you will be performing data site visits and site recon/assessment - occasional in-state travel and field work is required!
Qualifications:
We would love to talk to you if you have any of the following:
Bachelors and/or Master’s degree in Civil, Environmental, Agricultural Engineering with a water resources or environmental focus.
Engineer In Training license with the expectation to sit for the Florida Professional Engineering Exam within 2 years of hiring.
2+ years of experience with stormwater management, watershed and floodplain management and planning, natural systems mitigation and restoration design and management, and/or stream and wetland design.
Experience with AutoCAD/AutoCAD Civil 3D, TR-55, HEC-RAS/HMS, ICPR V4, XPSWMM, Rosgen IV stream design, and GIS.
Knowledge of basic civil site design fundamentals (grading, drainage, topography, coordination with survey, culvert/pipe sizing, open channel design).
Ability to research and analyze different treatment techniques and propose innovative restoration design approaches for water quality treatment and their impacts on nutrients and feasibility in the water budget analysis.
What will make you stand out?
PE License in the state of Florida.
Experience preparing water budgets and floodplain analyses, H&H investigation, groundwater hydrology, and stream and wetland biological functionality.
Knowledge of watershed level hydrology, stream geomorphology, physicochemical processes, stream hydraulics, water quality, design/assessment of urban/agricultural water resource and nutrient management best management practices, aquatic ecology, and sediment quality and transport.
Experience designing ecological and hydrological restoration projects, including terrestrial, coastal, estuarine, aquatic, and/or wetlands restoration projects.
Knowledge of stream natural channel design, including geomorphology, physicochemical processes, stream hydraulics, aquatic ecology, and sediment transport in Florida.
Direct experience with Federal/State/Local environmental regulations and staff and understanding of the Federal Clean Water Act, State Stormwater Rule, and other state and federal environmental regulations, and permitting processes.
Knowledge of field survey and data collection techniques for streams, wetlands and monitoring wells, and water quality and flow monitoring.

VEVRAA Federal Contractor
RES is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Opportunities may include projects for large landscape-level flood mitigation, water storage, water supply, aquifer recharge, and nutrient reduction projects related to EPA’s Impaired Waters Rule/Total Maximum Daily Loads (TMDLs) and Florida’s Basin Management Action Plans (BMAPs)... Bachelors and/or Master’s degree in Civil, Environmental, Agricultural Engineering with a water resources or environmental focus... Job_Description:
Production Quality Engineer
East Moline, Illinois - Full Time
Productive Resources (www.productiveresources.com) is seeking a candidate to be part of our engineering team at John Deere's facility in East Moline, Illinois. As a member of our team, the selected candidate will provide quality planning, control, and improvement support for product development teams, manufacturing engineering, supply management, and manufacturing and/or distribution organizations to assure John Deere product quality meets the customers' expectations. This includes the application of quality tools within the Enterprise Product Delivery Process (EPDP), Enterprise Order Fulfillment Process (EOFP) and Customer Support Process (CSP). Also support the application of quality tools with key suppliers as an integral element of quality planning.
This is a full-time position that is indefinite in duration with the opportunity of professional growth, and additional opportunities within our organization.
Duties:
Line support of assembly line production.
Issue documentation, work orders.
Operator training.
Completion of efficiency projects.
Completion of safety projects.
Adherence to Harvester Safety Guidelines.
Work 40-hour work weeks minimum
Requirements:
Good communication skills and demonstrated ability to work effectively with salaried and wage personnel in a team environment.
A self-starter with the ability to execute a variety of tasks.
Understanding of manufacturing processes and working in a production environment
Must be open to variable shifts, notably 3rd
Preferred Skills:
Creo, Autodesk, 3D modeling software experience helpful.
As a condition of employment consideration, Productive Resources conducts pre-employment screening, including a background check and drug test. In addition, an employment candidate is required to provide proof of identity and legal authority to work in the United States.
Why work for Productive Resources?
Productive Resources is a full-service engineering firm with over two decades of experience serving leading global clients. Harvest Systems PV&V Engineer
East Moline, IL - Full Time
Productive Resources (www.productiveresources.com) is seeking a candidate to be part of our engineering team at our customer's facility in East Moline, IL. Collect data, analyze data, create reports.

Field testing experience.
General understanding of combine machine functions.
Experience with collecting and analyzing data.
Strong problem-solving skills.
Hands on experience with operation and maintenance of farm equipment.
Strong communication skills - experience working cross functionally.

Combine/front end equipment field testing experience.
Experience developing new test equipment and methods.
Creo 3D modeling skills and design experience.
Experience collecting data with EDAQ.
Experience using Vision system.
PV&V planning experience.

Job_Description:
Founded in Tel Aviv in 2016, UVeye is a computer vision and data company that creates automatic vehicle inspection systems to encourage road safety and increase transparency across the automotive industry. With key partnerships including General Motors, Volvo, and CarMax among others, our technology is utilized in manufacturing plants, dealerships, wholesale auctions, delivery fleets, security checkpoints and more.

Want to be an important part of setting the standard for safety in the auto industry? Check out the description below to see if you’re a great fit!

We are looking for an experienced Field Service Engineer to join the US Operations Team. As Field service engineer you will be working on-site, for deployments, routine maintenance, conducting site visits, monitoring schedules, designing customer site layouts, evaluating environmental impact, mitigating risk and ensuring compliance. running field operations, analyzing data, overseeing equipment maintenance, job planning, troubleshooting, and supporting overall project objectives. Your technical expertise will assist our organization in increasing client satisfaction, improving efficiency, managing risk, and diagnosing problems.

Here’s what you’ll be doing:
New System Installation.
Scheduling tasks at each job site.
Troubleshooting issues.
Performing emergency services.
Writing detailed technical reports.
Training others to use equipment.
Ensuring proper adherence to safety requirements in facilities.
Designing Sites Layouts (CAD).
Performing maintenance work on schedule.

Requirements:
Minimum 4 years of experience as a Field Engineer / Field Technician or similar position, installation and deployment of a multidisciplinary product (Hardware & Software).
Experience with hands-on type of work (civil works, network and electrical wiring, mechanical assemblies).
Ability to write installation and maintenance procedures.
Basic knowledge with Linux based systems.
Basic networking knowledge.
Must be willing to travel up to 90% of the time.
Ability to work in a fast-changing environment.
Good verbal communication and interpersonal skills.
Required previous experience working with Autocad / Autodesk software (Both generate and reading drawings)
Must have a valid drivers license.
Must reside in along the west coast near a major airport.

Bonus if you have:
Experience working in startup companies.
Certified electrician diploma.
Degree in Mechanical Engineering.
Previous experience in product demonstration and training.
Experience with CAD software.
Experience in automotive industry.

Benefits we offer:

Competitive Medical, Dental, Vision
Company 401k Match
20 PTO days, Company paid holidays
Competitive wages with overtime over 40 hours
Career growth as we scale across the US

Check out our Life at UVeye page to learn more about the employee experience.

UVeye an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

Job_Description:
5+ years of analyzing and interpreting data with Redshift, Oracle, NoSQL etc. experience
Experience with data visualization using Looker, Quicksight, or similar tools
Experience with data modeling, warehousing and building ETL pipelines
Experience writing complex SQL queries
Experience using SQL to pull data from a database or data warehouse and scripting experience (Python) to process data for modeling
Ability to communicate complex ideas simply, coherently and fluently both in writing and verbally.
At Amazon Pharmacy, you will have the opportunity to make a tangible impact on both the company as well as the quality of our customers’ lives. We have a variety of roles of differing scope available across several teams and would love the opportunity to help you learn more about what’s available. Join our team and help create the future of medicine.

We are looking for a Business Intelligence Engineer to join our team. Working closely with partners from Product, Marketing, Finance, Engineering and Operations, you will develop reporting and insights solutions for the team's data and econometric models.

Responsibilities
You know and love solving problems using data, working with business intelligence tools, can build ETL pipelines, statistical models using multidimensional data sets and can partner with business owners to answer key questions. You are analytical, innovative, creative, disruptive, and you don’t give up. In this role you will have an opportunity to launch new features in our data lake from scratch, add new products to our inventory, influence targeting strategy for our products, implement end to end reporting solutions and support product managers in their day to day testing and business needs.
You will also have the opportunity to display your skills in the following areas:

1. Interface with product managers, data engineers and software developers, gather requirements and deliver complete analytics/reporting solutions.
2. Own the design, development, and maintenance of datasets, metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisions.
3. Make recommendations for new metrics, techniques, and strategies to improve campaign targeting and measurement.
4. Improve Amazon Pharmacy's capabilities/products and help business owners uncover hidden opportunities using data, analytics and machine learning.
5. Provide ad-hoc and automated access to large data sets.
6. Understand business and product strategies, goals and objectives. Set the analytics roadmap to drive the goals of the business.
7. Own the analytics for one or more product areas, lead planning, execution and delivery of projects for that area(s), manage stakeholders and internal customer/client needs/requests

Key job responsibilities
1. Partner with Pharmacy business, tech and data science leadership to define and deliver a world-class data infrastructure supporting Amazon Pharmacy's continued growth and our mission to be Earth's Best Pharmacy.
2. Architect scalable and resilient data solutions for real time and batch processing. Build self-service business intelligence infrastructure for Amazon Pharmacy analytics users
3. Work with BIEs/SDEs/other DEs to invent, design and build data solutions that are stable and performant.
4. Help your team evolve by actively participating in the code review process, design discussions, team planning, and ticket/metric/COE reviews

About the team
We accelerate business insights and data-driven innovation by providing trustworthy, intuitive, on-time and cost-efficient analytics and data engineering solutions. To accomplish our vision:
1. We provide data warehousing solutions for the undifferentiated heavy lifting that Amazon Pharmacy teams must engage in to work with data.
2. We identify and capitalize on opportunities for privacy and security improvements, cost reduction, and greater organizational efficiency
3. we continuously look ahead to identify common patterns in analytics and ‘pave the road’ for Amazon Pharmacy teams to quickly and easily solve business objectives and derive insights from data using native AWS solutions wherever possible and finally
4. we surface key performance indicators for product and process improvements spanning across various pharmacy departments.

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

Austin, TX, USA | Seattle, WA, USA

Experience managing, analyzing and communicating results to senior leadership
Experience with AWS solutions such as EC2, DynamoDB, S3, and Redshift
Experience in data mining, ETL, etc. and using databases in a business environment with large-scale, complex datasets.
Ability to manage a large and varied operational workload and stakeholder expectations

Experience with data modeling, warehousing and building ETL pipelines
Knowledge of professional software engineering & best practices for full software development life cycle, including coding standards, software architectures, code reviews, source control management, continuous deployments, testing, and operational excellence
Amazon’s global fulfillment network enables any merchant to ship items that are ordered on Amazon to any place on earth. There is a complex network of ways in which items move between vendor locations, Amazon warehouses, and customer locations as well as several intermediate locations through which packages travel before reaching the customer. With a scale of millions of packages, each with different attributes and delivery requirements, what results is a highly dense graph of nodes.

We have built a highly respected software engineering team which is focused on solving complex problems in worldwide transportation using workflows, optimization algorithms, and machine learning systems. These are large-scale distributed systems handling millions of packages being shipped through the Amazon logistics network.

You will be working with senior engineers and principals to solve problems of scale, improve existing services & build new ones, and work on deep and complex algorithms to improve the experience of our customers globally while optimizing network operations.

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

Bellevue, WA, USA

Experience with AWS technologies like Redshift, S3, AWS Glue, EMR, Kinesis, FireHose, Lambda, and IAM roles and permissions
Experience with non-relational databases / data stores (object storage, document or key-value stores, graph databases, column-family databases)

JOB CODE: GEO-H&H (I, II)-02-24 | OFFICE LOCATION: Foxboro, MA
Pare Corporation has a position available for candidates with entry level to five years of experience for Engineer I or II in the Hydrology & Hydraulic (H&H) Group, which serves under our Geotechnical Division based out of our Foxboro, MA office. The H&H Group is dedicated to identifying and analyzing riverine-related flood risk and developing solutions to address that flood risk for a variety of applications within the civil engineering industry. These positions offer the opportunity for a variety of field and office assignments with excellent opportunities for career growth and development.
How To Apply
Please send your résumé and a cover letter, noting your professional experience, education, and salary requirements. Your cover letter should express your specific areas of interest and provide additional information supporting the educational and professional experience listed in your résumé. Please reference the Position Code in your cover letter
You may mail your letter and résumé to our office at the address below
Résumés submitted without a cover letter will not be considered.
Human Resources
Pare Corporation
8 Blackstone Valley Place
Lincoln, RI 02865
Pare Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer and maintains a policy of affirmative action for minorities and women, individuals with disabilities, and protected veterans.
Pare Corporation does not sponsor Visas. Applicants must be eligible for employment in the United States of America.

Job_Description:
iHerb is continuing to expand its global cloud and Kubernetes infrastructure. The DevOps engineer role will be leading the implementation of systems like AWS, Kubernetes, Ansible and Flux. There are many new exciting projects that you will also work on such as automation and ensuring uptime across systems. You will have the opportunity to be exposed to many new technologies and global teams and be able to make an immediate impact as a core member.
In this role you will:
Collaborate with and across Agile teams to design, develop, test, implement, and support technical solutions in full-stack development tools and technologies
Oversee AWS, GCP and VMWare environments
Administer Linux and Windows servers
Work directly with development teams on troubleshooting and deployment
Create automated pipelines for infrastructure creation
Help architect new services and environments
In order to be successful you must have the following to be considered:
At least 5 plus years of experience in system administration or DevOps
Writing scripts (Bash, Powershell, Python, Go…)
Experience administrating Linux and Windows servers
Have deployed infrastructure on cloud platforms (GCP, AWS, Azure…)
Infrastructure automation tools (Terraform, CloudFormation, Ansible, Flux…)
Build and deployment pipelines (Jenkins, BitBucket, GitLab, Spinnaker…)
Network troubleshooting fundamentals (traceroutes, DNS...)
Bonus:
Worked with VMWare/VSphere
Experience working with Kubernetes
#LI-JC1 #LI-REMOTE
The anticipated pay scale for this position can be found below, however the pay range applicable to you may vary by geographic location based on where the job is located or where you work. The final pay offered to a successful candidate will be dependent on several factors that may include but are not limited to the type and years of experience within the job, the type of years and experience within the industry, education, etc. iHerb, LLC is a multi-state employer and this pay scale may not reflect positions that work in other states or locations.

Eligibility requirements for these benefits will be controlled by applicable plan documents.
Hired applicant may be awarded Restrict Stock Units and receive annual bonuses pursuant to eligibility and performance criteria defined in the respective plan documents and policies.
For more information on iHerb benefits, visit us at iHerbBenefits.com.

$162,190—$221,169 USD
Staffing Agency Submission Notice
iHerb does not accept unsolicited 3rd party ("Agency") candidates. If requested to work on a role, any Agency candidates would be presented through the internal recruiting organization.
About iHerb
iHerb is on a mission to make health and wellness accessible to all. We offer Earth's best-curated selection of health and wellness products, at the best possible value, delivered with the most convenient experience.

We're the world's largest eCommerce platform dedicated to vitamins, minerals, and supplements, and other health and wellness products. For more than 25 years, we've been making it simple for people all over the world to purchase the highest quality products. From supplements to skincare to grocery items, we ship over 30,000 products, from over 1,200 brands direct to our customers in 185+ countries.

Our vision is to become the #1 destination for health and wellness across the world.

With a passion for wellness and a mind for innovative solutions, iHerb team members share a vision for a healthier world that drives them each day. Our 5 Shared Values unite our global team:

Embrace Diversity & Inclusion · Strive for Simplicity

At iHerb, we are dedicated to offering programs designed to help our employees and their families stay healthy, live well, and plan for their financial future. Built on a strong foundation, our programs provide options and upgrades with flexibility, protection, and security in mind. For the comprehensive benefits list, visit www.iHerbBenefits.com. Job_Description:
Engineer - The Drake Hotel
An Engineer is responsible for maintaining the physical functionality and safety of the facility in the hotel's continuing effort to deliver outstanding guest service and financial profitability.

As an Engineer, you would be responsible for maintaining the physical functionality and safety of the facility in the hotel's continuing effort to deliver outstanding guest service and financial profitability. Specifically, you would be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standards:
Maintain the physical functionality and safety of the facility including, but not limited to, guest rooms, public space and heart-of-the-house areas

Perform a variety of repair and maintenance tasks including, but not limited to carpentry, plumbing, electrical work, painting, HVAC work and masonry
Conduct inspections for preventive maintenance needs
Record and report completed repairs and items that require further attention
What are we looking for?

Quality

Job Description:
Parsons is looking for an amazingly talented Software Project Engineer to join our team! In this role you will get to assist with the planning, coordination, and monitoring of project performance for an ongoing software modernization effort.
What You'll Be Doing:
Assisting the Project Manager with the creation and updating of project artifacts throughout the entire software development life-cycle.
Monitoring project execution using tools like the Atlassian Suite, and being responsible for project artifact organization and maintenance
Assisting with briefing material creation, and status delivery to the customer
Keeping track of project risks, and highlighting project opportunities for better performance
Working closely with the customer to set and occasionally adjust planning guidance
Working closely with the technical staff to keep the rhythm of project progress and track against definitions-of-done

Refer to Job Description for Education and Experience Requirements
Knowledge and experience with software project management methodologies (Agile/Scrum, SAFe, etc) and tools that deploy those methodologies (Atlassian Suite, GitLab, others)
Strong communication skills (both oral, written, and visual - ex: strong ppt creation skills)
A basic understanding of microservices and cloud-native technologies

Experience with software modernization projects (ex: transforming a legacy thick-client application into a cloud-deployable solution)
Prior software development experience
A knowledge of DoDAF / UML / SysML
Experience working with the CBRND community and associated technologies
Experience working with Mission Command and decision support tools

Not Applicable/None

Job_Description:
Sr. Manufacturing Engineer
If you are an experienced Manufacturing Engineer, please read on!

Based out of Orange County, CA we are a defense and space manufacturing company providing sustainability solutions to the emerging aerospace industry. Our next generation technology provides spatial awareness data and orbital transport solutions to clients with satellites in low-earth orbit.

Our next manufacturing engineer will be comfortable working with electromechanical hardware to help iterate on both our ground and in-air technology. They should have an understanding of process optimization methods and quality planning efforts.
Top Reasons to Work with Us
Work on the cutting edge of space flight technology
Great company culture and benefits
Growing company with room for growth
What You Will Be Doing
Working with technicians and other engineers hands-on, building prototype hardware
Writing documentation required for successfully manufacturing hardware at scale
Developing process flows, breaking down large, complex assemblies into a logical part flows
Developing novel tooling solutions for fabrication and assembly of structural parts
What You Need for this Position
2+ years of manufacturing experience with:
Electromechanical Hardware
Process and quality engineering

Bonus:
PCBA/Circuit board manufacturing
Aerospace/aviation experience
So, if you are an experienced Manufacturing Engineer, please apply today!
Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

CyberCoders is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Job_Description:
Production engineers are responsible for improving production at the factory level. They support production teams and engineering teams, report issues to the supervisor/manager, and develop strategies to improve efficiency. This position is very hands-on and relied upon to make critical decisions based on knowledge and experience.
In this role, your Responsibilities Will Be:
The Production Engineer will be encouraged to support the manufacturing processes, ensuring quality work is done in a safe and efficient manner. This position will be a liaison for manufacturing engineers to develop plans that improve production, costs, and labor required.
This position will work closely in assisting Job Setters and Supervisors in diagnosing problems in the production line and providing recommendations and training.
Establish safety procedures and protocols that take the workers’ well-being into account and minimize the carbon footprint
Keeping abreast of advancements in engineering and production and the ability to share knowledge with co-workers
Identifying, documenting, and reporting unsafe practices
Scheduling meetings with relevant departments and team members
Analyzing all facets of production and making recommendations for improvement
Who You Are:
You identify and seize new opportunities. You deal constructively with problems that do not have clear solutions or outcomes. You build and deliver solutions that meet customer expectations. You push yourself and help others achieve results.
SHIFT: 2nd: 3 pm – 11 pm
For this Role, You Will Need:
5+ years in machine setup and/or machining process
CNC Programming
Strong Machining Background. I.e. proven experience in the engineering field or experience in machine setup and/or machining process
Experience with horizontal and vertical CNC machines and multi-turret lathes
Experience with CAD software
Proficiency in MS Office
Legal authorization to work in the United States - Sponsorship will not be provided for this position.
Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart:
G&M Code/Programming
Our Offer to You:
We recognize the importance of employee wellbeing and know that to do your best you must have flexible, competitive benefit plans to meet you and your family’s physical, mental, financial, and social needs. We provide a variety of medical insurance plans, with dental and vision coverage. Employee Assistance Program, 401(k), tuition reimbursement, employee resource groups, recognition, and much more. Our culture prioritizes work-life balance and offers flexible time off plans, including paid parental leave (maternal and paternal), vacation, and holiday leave.
At Emerson, we are committed to encouraging a culture where every employee is valued and respected for their outstanding experiences and perspectives. We believe a diverse and inclusive work environment contributes to the rich exchange of ideas and diversity of thoughts, that encourage innovation and bring the best solutions to our customers.
The philosophy is fundamental to living our company’s values and our responsibility to leave the world in a better place. Learn more about our Culture and values and Diversity, Equity, and inclusion at Emerson .
Our training programs and initiatives focus on end-to-end development, from onboarding through senior leadership. We provide a wide range of development opportunities, including face-to-face and virtual training, mentorship, and coaching, project management, and on-the-job training.
About our location:
Since the invention of the modern pipe wrench in 1923, the 25-acre RIDGID world headquarters in Elyria, OH has been developing tools that help trades professionals tackle jobs faster, safer, and more accurately. Today, more than 600 employees work in 734K sq. ft. of office and manufacturing space. The campus is also home to a factory tool service center and an innovative “schoolhouse” training center that educates and trains hundreds of tradespersons annually. In addition to the iconic wrench, the campus manufactures RIDGID battery hydraulic tools, pipe and electrical tools, drain cleaning components, as well as Greenlee step bits and knock-out tools. Emerson’s Professional Tools business provides the industry’s broadest portfolio of advanced, reliable tools and technologies for the mechanical, electrical, and plumbing trades.
#LI-BS

WHY EMERSON
Our Commitment to Our People
At Emerson, we are motivated by a spirit of collaboration that helps our diverse, multicultural teams across the world drive innovation that makes the world healthier, safer, smarter, and more sustainable. And we want you to join us in our bold aspiration.
We have built an engaged community of inquisitive, dedicated people who thrive knowing they are welcomed, trusted, celebrated, and empowered to solve the world’s most complex problems — for our customers, our communities, and the planet. You’ll contribute to this vital work while further developing your skills through our award-winning employee development programs. We are a proud corporate citizen in every city where we operate and are committed to our people, our communities, and the world at large. We take this responsibility seriously and strive to make a positive impact through every endeavor.
At Emerson, you’ll see firsthand that our people are at the center of everything we do. So, let’s go. Let’s think differently. Learn, collaborate, and grow. Seek opportunity. Push boundaries. Be empowered to make things better. Speed up to break through. Let’s go, together.

Emerson will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States. This is not a position for which sponsorship will be provided. Individuals with temporary visas such as E, F-1(including those with OPT or CPT) , H-1, H-2, L-1, B, J or TN, or who need sponsorship for work authorization now or in the future, are not eligible for hire.
Equal Opportunity Employer
Emerson is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, color, religion, national origin, age, marital status, political affiliation, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, disability or protected veteran status. We are committed to providing a workplace free of any discrimination or harassment.
Accessibility Assistance or Accommodation
If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, please contact: idisability.administrator@emerson.com .

ABOUT EMERSON
Emerson is a global leader in automation technology and software. Through our deep domain expertise and legacy of flawless execution, Emerson helps customers in critical industries like life sciences, energy, power and renewables, chemical and advanced factory automation operate more sustainably while improving productivity, energy security and reliability.
With global operations and a comprehensive portfolio of software and technology, we are helping companies implement digital transformation to measurably improve their operations, conserve valuable resources and enhance their safety.
We offer equitable opportunities, celebrate diversity, and embrace challenges with confidence that, together, we can make an impact across a broad spectrum of countries and industries. Whether you’re an established professional looking for a career change, an undergraduate student exploring possibilities, or a recent graduate with an advanced degree, you’ll find your chance to make a difference with Emerson. Job_Title: Design Engineer – Land Stewardship and Infrastructure
Job_Description:
Job Position
Design Engineer – Land Stewardship and Infrastructure
Ideal candidates will have relevant experience and a willingness to participate in the growth of the company.
Company Description
Line and Grade is a civil engineering and land-use consulting firm. We are a small interdisciplinary team of dedicated, passionate, and creative professionals who love to explore the limits of what our profession can offer. Our fundamental goal is to invest our work in common ground, common spaces and in alignment with clients who see the landscape as a shared resource – no matter who owns it. Our work is primarily (but not exclusively) in Central Virginia. We specialize in assisting local agencies, institutions, and development partners with informed expertise to build projects that last, and which will be of tangible benefit to the communities they serve.
Job Description
Use professional judgment to independently complete engineering design tasks
Assist the Project Manager, or act as the project manager, to work toward specific project tasks
Ability to make engineering/design decisions based on informed inputs and professional judgment while understanding and coordination the impacts of such decisions.
Proactively identifies technical, schedule and financial challenges/opportunities and works with the team to resolve and guide appropriate action
Monitor and supervise construction projects and field personnel
Capable to communicate technical matters with internal team and external collaborators
Qualifications and Skills
Skills and Requirements of a successful candidate may include:
Ideal candidates will have at least 3 years of experience and have an Engineer-in-Training certificate. Licensed Professional Engineering candidates are preferred.
Intermediate AutoCAD/Civil 3D experience
Familiarity with, and willingness to advance in, analysis programs (Excel, Hydrology software, etc.)
Exhibit perseverance in professional work and a willingness to solve complex design challenges
Ability to share similar work products (designs, reports, calculations) and expound upon work experience
Experience working on projects centered around the public realm and common spaces is a plus
Benefits and Compensation
100% employer paid health insurance
Retirement savings with matching
PTO + 8 paid holidays
Profit Sharing Bonus Program
Healthy and Balanced Work Environment
Leadership Opportunities
Inclusive business decision making
Compensation commensurate with experience
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $75,000.00 - $115,000.00 per year
Benefits:
401(k) matching
Flexible schedule
Health insurance
Health savings account
Paid time off
Parental leave
Professional development assistance
Retirement plan
Schedule:
No nights
No weekends
Supplemental pay types:
Bonus opportunities
Work Location: Hybrid remote in Charlottesville, VA 22902

Job_Description:
We have a full-time opportunity for a Civil Drafter/Designer in our San Diego office. Prospects should have an excellent work ethic, be technically driven and possess experience with drafting for a wide variety of land development projects.
Responsibilities:
Prepare construction drawings for site grading, drainage, and storm water management for land development projects
Prepare septic layouts utilizing the current County of San Diego DEHQ LAMP
Prepare plats and exhibits to accompany legal descriptions
Prepare property boundaries using record maps and accompanying deeds and title reports
Ability to download/upload civil 3D points and create base topography
Ability to take design files and set-up for construction support and coordinate with surveyor
Work closely with other engineers, designers and drafters to ensure a coordinated design
Make required changes, additions, and/or revisions, as directed
Apply standard design principles to accommodate governing agency requirements for submittal and ultimately project approval
Organize and collect required plans, applications, forms and estimates and process submittal through various local agencies
Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously
Follow company CAD standards and QAQC protocol
Requirements
High degree of proficiency using AutoCAD /CIVIL 3D software
Prefer at least 3 years of full-time experience in Civil Design
E.I.T. preferred but not required
Storm Water and hydrology experience is a plus
Familiar with Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook
Benefits:
Health Insurance
Paid vacation, sick leave and holidays
Casual working environment
Flexible Scheduling
Half day every Friday, and we work remotely Mondays & Fridays

Job_Description:
Senior System Administrator – Multi-Domain Engineer
We are seeking a Senior System Administrator – Multi-Domain Engineer to join a growing Managed/Cloud Service Provider. The Senior System Administrator – Multi-Domain Engineer will work with small to large companies to consultant on Cloud Solutions and provide them with Network / Systems consulting and support, while also performing back-end administration.
The Senior System Administrator – Multi-Domain Engineer involves working a mixed day, approximately 60% backend administration/escalated server support, 40% projects. This environment consists of multi-vendor equipment using a variety of networking protocols located within multiple client sites.
On a daily basis, the Senior System Administrator – Multi-Domain Engineer will be responsible for multiple levels of network/desktop support and network design activities, with additional duties centered around the ability to triage and solve critical networking issues in a short amount of time.
Senior System Administrator – Multi-Domain Engineer Requirements:
Up to date IT Network Engineer skills, strong Windows support and troubleshooting of network infrastructure
Experience engineer and supporting networking components with virtualization/cloud technologies, specifically VMware
Experience with network security and firewalls (Cisco is a plus)
Network troubleshooting and solutions for small to medium-sized company systems
Migration experience (Email, Server, P2V).
Senior System Administrator – Multi-Domain Engineer Technology:
O365 administration (including migrations)
VMware ESXi
Windows Server and 2016 and up
Basic networking fundamentals
Azure AD & Azure VMs
Senior System Administrator – Multi-Domain Engineer Salary/Benefits:
100% Employee paid medical, dental, vision coverage
Profit-sharing
Certification Reimbursement
Generous PTO Plan
Down to earth company culture
Emphasis on work/life balance – re mote work
Opportunity to work with the latest and greatest technology

*Actual salary for Senior System Administrator – Multi-Domain Engineer to commensurate with experience*
Opportunity Location
Houston, TX
Proposed Salary
$100,000 - $115,000

Company_Name: Tablet Hotels - The Hotel Experts at MICHELIN
Job_Description:
Tablet is all about discovering the world's most extraordinary hotels — places where you'll find a memorable experience, not just a room for the night. For 20+ years we’ve scoured the earth, evaluating hotels that meet our high standards across every price point, creating a hand-picked selection that’s proven and inspired. In fact, our painstaking curation led to Michelin making us the official hotel selection of their legendary MICHELIN Guide. The MICHELIN Guide had always been a benchmark in gastronomy. Now it’s setting the same standard for hotels.
Our mission is to open doors to places people will love that they might not have found on their own, extraordinary places that reflect the beauty and diversity of the world. Our team believes that travel brings people of all backgrounds together. Our hotels provide an unforgettable backdrop for that union.
Headquartered in New York City, we operate in eight languages, with thousands of incredible hotels located in over a hundred different countries. And if you really want to take it to the next level, our Tablet Plus Travel Club provides VIP upgrades and amenities at hundreds of our properties.
Backend Engineer
While maintaining core Tablet Hotels products, our team also leads design and development for the MICHELIN Guide. Projects are becoming increasingly ambitious as we continue to expand internationally. We’re growing in order to support an evolving product ecosystem for two brands with feature parity across three mobile apps and two websites.
Our backend team is focused on supporting and expanding the functionality of our booking engine, payment processing, and inventory management systems used by MICHELIN Guide and Tablet Hotels platforms. Sitting on the ARI team (Availability, Rates, and Inventory), you’ll report to our Lead Backend Engineer and work on the engine that powers hotel pricing and booking. The ARI team is critical to our sales and distribution teams in maintaining competitive advantage. We offer opportunities for ownership, autonomy, and collaboration with various teams throughout the organization.
Current ARI initiatives include:
Optimizing queuing, caching, and computational efficiency of our most important endpoints
Improving our technological capacity to compete in metasearch
Replacing and revitalizing our software platform for hotels
Optimized 3rd party integrations
Improved tooling for sales
Improved user tools
We’re a high retention organization with a hands-on contributing management team. If you’re self-directed and do better work when trusted with freedom and flexibility, we may be an excellent fit.
Requirements:
5+ years software engineering experience with Python
Confidence with *nix based command-line tools
Experience designing RESTful API services
Experience with Google Metasearch
Experience with Stripe

This is a hybrid role requiring two days per week in our New York City office.
$125 - 140k Annual salary based on experience

We are a small company that offers big opportunities for personal growth that is nurtured in a team and collaborative culture. Your career will grow because the most of our work is focused on design and analysis of mainly large commercial agricultural and industrial facilities. The bulk of our work is new foundation and steel framing design, in addition to renovation and repair work for existing structures. We have a design build collaborative approach to projects with the Owners and Contractors, to set project expectations and clarify scope early to minimize redesign on projects. ASM is licensed in 36 states across the U.S.
Experienced-based, competitive salary with benefits including 401k matching, health insurance, dental insurance and paid vacation. Please call to inquire about more information at (316) 260-5895, ask for MonaLisa.
Qualification Requirements
We are looking for a candidate with a minimum of 5 years’ experience in structural engineering, using current drawings and software programs. Experience in design documentation creation/layout and ability to manage working on multiple projects simultaneously.
Project Management Responsibilities:
· Participate in the creation/review of proposals, scope of work, project schedules, budgets, project milestones, etc.
· Assist in proactively identifying potential problems with projects and provide assistance in resolving them to keep projects on schedule.
· Ensure project outputs are consistently high-quality deliverables, on time and within budget to all business objectives.
· Peer review of in-house structural design.
Experience, Educational & Professional Requirements:
· The candidate should have a minimum of 5 years’ structural engineer experience, demonstrating an increased level of professional development and responsibility.
· Professional Engineering (PE) license.
· Experience in RISA 3D and RISA Foundations.
Skill Requirements:
In addition to being enthusiastic about working in the field of engineering, the successful candidate should have the following skills:
· Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
· Establish professional working relationships with clients, and contractors.
· Excellent problem-solving abilities and critical thinking skills.
Energetic and flexible in order to perform in fast-paced environment and resolve challenges.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $100,000.00 - $150,000.00 per year
Benefits:
401(k)
401(k) matching
Dental insurance
Health insurance
Health savings account
Paid time off

8 hour shift

Monday to Friday
